0.title: 35-yr-old spiritual leader Khwaja Sayyad Chishti shot in the head in Maharashtra
0.article_body: Spiritual leader Khwaja Sayyad Chishti, also known as 'Sufi Baba', was shot dead in Maharashtra's Nashik on Tuesday. The 35-year-old was shot in the head and died instantly, and the killers escaped in one of his SUVs, police said. Sayyad Chishti, who was from Afghanistan, had lived in Nashik's Yeola town for several years.

1.title: Shiv Sena wants me to contest Pune Lok Sabha seat: Shivajirao
1.article_body: Former Shirur MP Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil has said that the Shiv Sena has urged him to prepare himself to contest the Pune Lok Sabha seat in the next general election. He was expelled by the Shiv Sena for posting a message congratulating new CM Eknath Shinde last week. However, Shiv Sena withdrew the expulsion order the next day.

2.title: GMDA to use drone surveillance for traffic management in Gurugram
2.article_body: Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority will start using drone technology for traffic management in Gurugram. The decision came following an increase in number of vehicles flouting norms and issues in traffic management. "The drone will also have a feature where it'll capture the vehicle's registration number plate and send a challan to those violating traffic rules online," an official said.

3.title: Shinde's wife plays drums as he reaches home 1st time after becoming CM
3.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's wife Lata Shinde played drums along with other musicians to welcome her husband home as he reached his residence first time after becoming the Chief Minister. In a video shared by news agency ANI, Lata can be seen smiling and playing drums. Several other people behind her can also be seen playing drums.

4.title: We need to prepare for complete cut-off of Russian gas: EU chief
4.article_body: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday said that the 27 EU nations need to prepare for further disruption and "even a complete cut-off of Russian gas supply". The statement comes in view of the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. Russia has already restricted its gas supplies to some European countries.

5.title: Insult of Hindu deities won't be tolerated: MP CM to Mahua Moitra
5.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan criticised TMC MP Mahua Moitra for her "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess" remark and said that she has hurt Hindu religious sentiments. "Insult of Hindu deities will not be tolerated at any cost," Chouhan added. Meanwhile, a case was registered in Bhopal against Moitra for hurting religious sentiments.

6.title: ACB raids PMC official's properties, unearths assets worth ₹1 crore
6.article_body: Pune unit of the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) filed a case of disproportionate assets against Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) official Vijay Bhaskar Landge and his wife on Tuesday after unearthing assets worth ₹1.02 crore. ACB conducted searches in properties linked to Landge in Pune and Nashik. ACB found documents of 5.5-acre agricultural land and other properties owned by Landge.

7.title: Andhra MP, CRPF personnel assault policeman in Hyderabad; booked
7.article_body: Rebel MP of Andhra Pradesh's ruling YSR Congress Party, K Raghu Rama Krishna Raju, his son, his personal assistant and two CRPF personnel were booked for allegedly assaulting a policeman in Hyderabad. The complainant alleged that he was attacked with sticks and forcibly carried in their car while on duty and was illegally confined in Raju's house for three hours.

8.title: Clay recycling campaign to be launched in Pune this Ganesha Chaturthi
8.article_body: In view of the Ganesha Chaturthi festival, several Pune-based organisations have decided to launch a clay recycling campaign in Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad municipal corporation areas. The clay sludge will be collected in residential societies, drop-off points across the city and at a few selected ghats. The clay will be transported to artists.

9.title: Bring it on BJP, I'm not afraid of police: Mahua on complaints over Goddess Kali remark
9.article_body: After the BJP filed several police complaints against TMC MP Mahua Moitra for her remarks on Goddess Kali, she tweeted, "Bring it on BJP!" Moitra added, "Am a Kali worshipper. I am not afraid of anything. Not your ignoramuses. Not your goons. Not your police. And most certainly not your trolls." She also wrote, "Truth doesn't need back up forces."

10.title: Businessman forces wife to attend wife-swapping parties in Delhi; booked
10.article_body: A Gurugram businessman has been booked for allegedly forcing his wife to attend wife-swapping parties in Delhi. "If I refused...my husband would thrash and sexually abuse me," she alleged. The FIR was registered by UP Police after she approached a Muzaffarnagar court claiming she was intercepted by her husband's goons when she tried to approach Gurugram Police.

11.title: I'm suffering from character blindness: Rajamouli's cousin on Resul's tweet
11.article_body: Reacting to Oscar-winning film sound designer Resul Pookutty calling RRR a 'gay love story', the film's director SS Rajamouli's cousin and music composer MM Keeravaani tweeted, "I [am now suffering]...from character blindness." "I am not able to see [actors Ram Charan] and...[Jr NTR's] characters from RRR anymore (who looked like having shared a special relationship)," he added on Twitter.

12.title: Punjab cabinet approves 300 units of free electricity to every household
12.article_body: The Punjab cabinet on Wednesday approved the decision to provide 300 units of free electricity to every household in the state. Taking to Twitter, CM Bhagwant Mann said, "We had guaranteed the people of Punjab that we will give 300 units electricity free of cost as soon as we form government. This decision has been approved by the cabinet today."

13.title: Water levels of 4 dams supplying water to Pune rise after continuous rains
13.article_body: Water levels of the four dams supplying water to Pune city are slowly rising following continuous rainfall in the catchment areas. The storage in Khadakwasla, Panshet, Varasgaon and Temghar dams has reportedly reached 3.67 thousand million cubic feet (TMC). Last week, due to deficit rainfall, the water storage in the four dams had dropped to 2.5 TMC.

14.title: Daughter said 'Your Spice Girls skirts were too short, unacceptable': Victoria
14.article_body: Singer Victoria Beckham said that her daughter Harper Seven Beckham said that Victoria's skirts during her time with 'Spice Girls' were "unacceptable". "Harper actually said to me recently, 'Mummy, I've seen some pictures of you when you were in the Spice Girls, and your skirts...were just too short.' Then David piped up and said, 'Absolutely, Harper! They really...were'," she added.

15.title: Rishabh Pant can open for Team India in T20Is: Wasim Jaffer
15.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said the Team India management should think about wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant as an opener in T20Is. "I think that's the spot where Rishabh can blossom," added Jaffer. Pant smashed the fastest Test hundred by an Indian wicketkeeper in the fifth Test against England. He scored 146(111) in the first innings and 57(86) in the second.

16.title: BMC issues advisory amid rising dengue, malaria cases in Mumbai
16.article_body: Amid rising dengue and malaria cases in Mumbai, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has issued an advisory requesting citizens to take extra care and not ignore fever. Nearly 40 cases of gastro and malaria have been reported across Mumbai in the first three days of July. Zen Multi Speciality Hospital's Dr Vikrant Shah said, "[Viral] cases are...[rising]...due to sudden changes in...climate."

17.title: Several police complaints filed against Mahua Moitra over her remarks on Goddess Kali
17.article_body: Several police complaints have been filed against TMC MP Mahua Moitra by the BJP across West Bengal over her remarks on Goddess Kali. Moitra had said, "For me, Goddess Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess." After a controversy erupted over her statement on the goddess, she tweeted, "I never backed any film or poster or mentioned the word smoking."

18.title: SpiceJet issued show cause notice after 8 malfunction incidents in 18 days
18.article_body: Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has issued a show cause notice to budget carrier SpiceJet after the airline reported eight malfunction incidents in last 18 days. It said that SpiceJet has "failed to establish safe, efficient and reliable air services". The Accountable Manager has been called upon to show cause within three weeks of receipt of the notice.

19.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann to marry for the 2nd time tomorrow, pic of wife-to-be surfaces
19.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann will get married to Dr Gurpreet Kaur in a private ceremony in Chandigarh on Thursday. It'll be his second marriage. He was earlier married to Inderpreet Kaur, with whom he got divorced in 2015. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is likely to attend the wedding with his family. Bhagwant Mann has two children from his first marriage.

20.title: Was told 'Offer Rajkummar cup of tea, send him away': Hansal on 'Shahid'
20.article_body: Discussing his 2013 film 'Shahid', director Hansal Mehta said, "I wasn't ready to meet [actor Rajkummar Rao]. Anurag Kashyap and [casting director] Mukesh Chhabra told me to...meet him once." Hansal added that Chhabra later called him to inform him that Rajkummar was standing outside his office. "[He told me to]...offer a cup of tea and send Rajkummar away," stated Hansal.

21.title: Shardul is not the same bowler we saw 18 months back: Manjrekar
21.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said all-rounder Shardul Thakur wasn't as effective in the rescheduled fifth Test against England as he was a few months back. "Shardul is not the same bowler we saw in Test cricket maybe 18 months back," stated Manjrekar. Shardul had picked seven wickets in two Tests he played against England last year.

22.title: Delhi govt warns parents against misuse of CCTV footage of classrooms
22.article_body: The Delhi government has warned parents and guardians of children studying in its schools from sharing the CCTV footage of classrooms. Parents have reportedly been asked to take a pledge that they will not share the password of the mobile app used to access the footage. Notably, the project was launched by the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in 2019.

23.title: Ukrainian Governor urges 3.5 lakh people to flee amid Russian offensive
23.article_body: Governor of Donetsk province, Pavlo Kyrylenko, urged over 3,50,000 residents to evacuate the province to save lives and to enable the Ukrainian army to better defend towns from the Russian onslaught. This comes after Russian forces struck targets across Ukraine's eastern Donetsk region on Tuesday, a day after Russian President Vladimir Putin declared victory in the neighbouring Luhansk province.

24.title: Blast at arms depot in Yemen kills at least 6, injures 32
24.article_body: At least six people were killed and 32 injured after a blast occurred at an arms depot in Yemen's Abyan province on Tuesday, said medical officials. Many of the wounded victims were said to be critical and the officials feared the death toll might rise. The cause of the explosion was not immediately known.

25.title: Minister, lawmaker resign from UK PM Johnson's government after Sunak, Javid's exit
25.article_body: British Minister for Children and Families Will Quince resigned on Wednesday, saying he was going after being given an "inaccurate" briefing over PM Boris Johnson's appointment of a politician who was subject of complaints. Lawmaker Laura Trott also stepped down from her role as Parliamentary Private Secretary to Department of Transport. This comes after Rishi Sunak and Sajid Javid's exit.

26.title: Meta sues individual who scraped data from 3.5 lakh Instagram profiles
26.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta has sued Turkey-based individual, Ekrem Ateş, for using automated Instagram accounts to scrape data from the profiles of over 3.5 lakh Instagram users. The individual later published that data on a series of clone sites. Meta has also sued Octopus, a US subsidiary of a Chinese firm, that offers data scraping-for-hire services to individuals and companies.

27.title: Over 1,100 people died of TB in Pune, Pimpri Chinchwad in last 2 years
27.article_body: According to the health authorities, more than 1,100 people have died of tuberculosis (TB) in the last two years in Pune city and Pimpri Chinchwad. There were 439 and 385 TB-related deaths in Pune in the year 2020 and 2021, respectively. Whereas in Pimpri-Chinchwad, 147 people succumbed to the infectious lung disease in 2020 and 162 died in 2021.

28.title: SC to hear anchor Rohit Ranjan's plea against FIRs over Rahul Gandhi video
28.article_body: Supreme Court on July 7 will hear TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan's plea against multiple FIRs over clips on Rahul Gandhi. "Please list this urgently...otherwise, he'll be in repeated custody," his lawyer told SC. Noida Police arrested Ranjan in connection with clips purportedly misquoting Gandhi and linking his statements on vandalism at his Wayanad office to the Udaipur tailor's murder.

29.title: Final construction on Delhi-Meerut Expressway to be completed in August: Official
29.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) officials said that the rail overbridge, which is the final structure on the Delhi-Meerut Expressway (DME), is expected to be complete by mid-August. We will close down three exits in Vijay Nagar area after construction of the rail overbridge located at Chipyana Bujurg near Crossings Republik is completed, an NHAI official said.

30.title: Man gets ₹60,000 from mobile network operator after number gets blocked in Tamil Nadu
30.article_body: A consumer court has asked a mobile network operator to give ₹60,000 as compensation to a Tamil Nadu man after his number was blocked and allocated to another person without explanation. The court asked the operator to pay ₹25,000 for deficiency in service and ₹30,000 for loss of customer's contacts as well as causing mental agony.

31.title: UDF protests outside Kerala Assembly over minister's remarks on Constitution
31.article_body: The opposition UDF led by Congress on Wednesday held a protest outside Kerala Assembly against state minister Saji Cherian's remarks on the Indian Constitution. "What Cherian said is not acceptable and [CM Pinarayi] Vijayan should ask for his resignation," said VD Satheesan, Leader of Opposition in the Assembly. Notably, Cherian had said that the Constitution exploits working-class people.

32.title: Couldn't take decisions on Dawood Ibrahim, Mumbai blasts in MVA govt: Shinde
32.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said, "Shiv Sena, BJP contested 2019 Assembly elections together but...government was formed with Congress and NCP...whenever issues of Hindutva...Savarkar...Mumbai blasts...[and] Dawood came up...we were unable to take a decision." He also said, "We have decided to take our Hindu Hriday Samrat Balasaheb Thackeray's Hindutva ideology further."

33.title: 4 detained for making threat calls to people supporting Nupur Sharma in Amravati
33.article_body: Amravati Police detained four people for making threat calls to people who made social media posts in support of Nupur Sharma. The police also appealed to people to contact the nearest police station if someone threatens them over their posts on Nupur Sharma, said Amravati Police Commissioner Arti Singh. She added the details of the complainant will be kept confidential.

34.title: 37-yr-old man run over by bus after bumping into pothole in Thane
34.article_body: A 37-year-old man was run over by a state bus after his motorcycle bumped into a pothole in Maharashtra's Thane on Tuesday. The incident occurred at Ghodbunder Road when the man lost his balance after hitting the pothole and fell off the motorcycle. The victim was rushed to the hospital where he was declared dead by doctors, reports said.

35.title: 30-day Delhi Shopping Festival will be organised in Jan-Feb 2023: CM
35.article_body: Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday said that a 30-day Delhi Shopping Festival will be organised from January 28 to February 26, 2023. "Heavy discounts will be offered. Entire Delhi will be decorated. Exhibitions will also be organised," he added. "I expect that in a few years, we will make it the biggest shopping festival in the world," Kejriwal further said.

36.title: Mahua unfollows TMC on Twitter after party condemns her remark on goddess Kaali
36.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra has unfollowed the official Twitter handle of TMC. This comes after the party distanced itself from her remarks on goddess Kaali. "To me, Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess," Moitra said. Following her statement, TMC said, "The comments made by [Moitra] and her views…have been made in her personal capacity…AITC strongly condemns such comments."

37.title: India creating ecosystem to make social media accountable: Vaishnaw
37.article_body: Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Tuesday called social media "a very powerful medium" that has a "big influence" on people's lives. "How to make it accountable has become a very valid question," Vaishnaw said. He added, "Everywhere across the globe and even in our country, an ecosystem, a thought process, is being created to make social media accountable."

38.title: Clear buys compliance risk management platform CimplyFive in all-cash deal
38.article_body: Fintech startup Clear, formerly known as ClearTax, has acquired compliance risk management platform CimplyFive in an all-cash deal, which was reportedly worth around ₹75 crore. As per a statement, CimplyFive will continue to run as an independent platform, led by its founder Shankar Jaganathan. Earlier this year, Clear acquired supply-chain financing company Xpedize for around ₹100 crore.

39.title: China-bound SpiceJet cargo plane returns over faulty weather radar, 3rd incident in 24 hrs
39.article_body: SpiceJet said its China-bound cargo plane returned to Kolkata on Tuesday as pilots realised after take-off that its weather radar wasn't working. It was the third incident of technical malfunction on a SpiceJet aircraft in 24 hours. Earlier on Tuesday, a Delhi-Dubai flight made emergency landing in Karachi over malfunctioning fuel indicator and a Kandla-Mumbai flight suffered a windshield crack.

40.title: Hard-fought series, competition was at its best: Jadeja on England Tests
40.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja took to Twitter to share pictures from Edgbaston Test, which India lost by seven wickets. He wrote, "Always a great feeling to contribute for my team, even though we fell short. A hard-fought series where the competition was at its best." Jadeja scored his first overseas hundred in international cricket in the match.

41.title: Sinner had nothing to lose before match but lot to lose 2 sets up: Novak
41.article_body: Following his comeback win after losing the first two sets against Italian tennis player Jannik Sinner in Wimbledon, Novak Djokovic said, "Sinner had nothing to lose before the match, but...lot to lose when...two sets...up." "I could feel that on a mental level...If you're up against...players like Sinner, who...[are playing] their first quarter-final...those things play a role," he added.

42.title: Turning point was India losing 6 wickets for 55 runs in 3rd innings: Deep
42.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Deep Dasgupta said the turning point of the fifth Test between India and England which the former lost by seven wickets, was India losing six wickets within 55 runs in the third innings. "We dominated the match for...first three days...We [could've] batted more carefully...An increase of 100 runs would have...reduced the overs for [the] final innings," added Deep.

43.title: Crypto sector has many business models, some are riskier: CoinSwitch CEO
43.article_body: CoinSwitch Kuber's CEO Ashish Singhal took to Twitter to say, "Crypto industry has several business models. Some are inherently riskier than others and can come undone, as recent events have shown." His statement came after cryptocurrency exchange Vauld suspended trading, deposits and withdrawals citing "financial difficulties". He also discussed CoinSwitch's business model in his tweets.

44.title: Blinken unlikely to hold talks with Russian Foreign Min at G20: US
44.article_body: US State Department spokesman Ned Price said he doesn't expect State Secretary Antony Blinken to meet with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov at G20 Foreign Ministers' meeting in Bali. Price said he expects G20 members to condemn Russia's invasion of Ukraine. However, Blinken will meet Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi for a "candid exchange" on Beijing’s response to Ukraine war.

45.title: India has to manage its own interests: EAM Jaishankar on Ukraine war
45.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that India has taken the "right course" on the Ukraine conflict and added that it is a very complex matter where the most urgent issue is to prevent hostilities from escalating. "We have historical interest, we have a strategic interest, we have current interests and we have to manage those interests," he added.

46.title: Thiruvananthapuram's Lulu mall to begin 'midnight shopping' concept on trial basis
46.article_body: Lulu International Shopping Mall in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram is set to introduce "midnight shopping" concept, state capital's first night-shopping model, on a trial basis from July 6. "Our main intention is...to ensure that public experience nightlife with less traffic, where they can purchase their daily needs in more peaceful atmosphere," Joy Shadanandan, Regional Director, Lulu group, said.

47.title: Man takes wrong turn using Google Maps in Gurugram, made to sweep road
47.article_body: A man in Gurugram has alleged that a constable made him sweep the road after he took a wrong turn as directed by Google Maps, which took him to a restricted area. "When I stepped out, he abused me," the man said, adding that the constable said he brought mud with tyres of the car. An inquiry has been initiated.

48.title: What is the story behind Joe Root's 'pinky finger' celebration against India?
48.article_body: England's Joe Root celebrated his Edgbaston Test hundred against India by wiggling his pinky finger. It was a reference to a scene from singer Elvis Presley's biopic 'Elvis'. In the movie, Elvis wiggles his little finger despite being ordered by police not to perform his signature movements. Root revealed Ben Stokes watched 'Elvis' and asked the team to be "rockstars".

49.title: Girl shares pics after her cheek was grazed by a bullet during US mass shooting
49.article_body: An 18-year-old girl has shared pictures of her injury after her cheek was grazed by a bullet in the US Independence Day parade mass shooting. "I can't believe I was in the middle of a mass shooting. I'm still in shock. I am so sorry for everyone who lost loved ones," the girl named Lilli said.

50.title: PFI activist arrested for training youth in martial arts in Telangana
50.article_body: A 52-year-old alleged activist of the Popular Front of India (PFI) was arrested in Nizamabad for reportedly training youth and children in martial arts. According to police, the accused, identified as Abdul Khader, was training innocent Muslims against Hindus and organizing physical training camps. Police seized books, bamboo sticks, stationery, teaching board, meeting mic etc from his possession.

51.title: Mumbai witnesses nearly 70% of average July rainfall in 5 days
51.article_body: Amid heavy rains, Mumbai witnessed 69.41% (594 mm) of the average July rainfall (855.7 mm) in the first five days of the month, as per India Meteorological Department (IMD) data. "Due to active monsoon conditions, rainfall activity over Konkan and adjoining ghat areas of Madhya Maharashtra is expected to increase in the next four to five days," IMD stated.

52.title: 3 Khans won't come on 'Koffee..'; I've no power, doomed by reputation: Karan
52.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said the three Khans will not be coming on the latest season of 'Koffee With Karan'. "I am doomed by the reputation...of my show," he said, adding, "I don't have...power to pull them [three Khans]. I can get them for a party but not on my show. I can't manage two also out of the three Khans."

53.title: 50-yr-old man rapes & impregnates 16-yr-old neighbour in Mumbai; arrested
53.article_body: A 50-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping his 16-year-old neighbour in Mumbai.  The accused reportedly asked the girl to help him move when he shifted to a new house. Later, he accused her of stealing things from his house and raped her before letting her go home, police said. The matter came to light when the girl became pregnant.

54.title: Cried when Nadal lost vs Djokovic in French Open 2021: Iga Świątek
54.article_body: World number one women's tennis player Iga Świątek said she "cried" after Rafael Nadal's loss against Novak Djokovic in the semi-final of French Open 2021. "Nadal has always been my idol," added Świątek. Talking about picking between singer Adele and Nadal, Świątek stated on Twitter, "I would need to listen to Rafa singing and see Adele playing tennis."

55.title: TMC should expel Moitra if they don't endorse her remark: BJP's Sukanta
55.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar said that TMC can't detach itself from Mahua Moitra's remark on goddess Kaali. "If TMC actually doesn't endorse it, they should take action and they should either expel her or suspend her from the party for a few days," Majumdar said. On Tuesday, TMC condemned Moitra's "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess" remark.

56.title: Jadeja bowls too flat, India missed a quality spinner: Lloyd on 5th Test
56.article_body: Ex-England cricketer David Lloyd said India were "hamstrung" by not having a quality spinner in the fifth Test against England which they lost by seven wickets, having not picked Ravichandran Ashwin. "[Ravindra Jadeja] tends to bowl too flat and...quick," added Lloyd. "Loop drift and spin bring dividends...Ashwin has it but India played safe-to their cost," he stated.

57.title: US pushes ASML to stop selling chipmaking gear to China: Report
57.article_body: The US is pushing semiconductor manufacturing equipment provider ASML to stop selling any more of its gear to Chinese chipmakers, Bloomberg reported. It's seeking to expand an existing moratorium on advanced chipmaking systems' sales to Chinese firms. "The discussion is not new. No decisions have been made, and we do not want to speculate or comment on rumours," ASML said.

58.title: Canada becomes 1st country to ratify Finland, Sweden's bids to join NATO
58.article_body: Canada became the first country to formally ratify Sweden and Finland's requests to join NATO after member nations signed off on the accession protocols on Tuesday. Parliaments of all 30 NATO members must ratify Finland and Sweden's bids before they can be protected by the NATO defence clause, which states an attack on one ally is an attack against all.

59.title: Instagram Direct down for many users across the globe for over 12 hours
59.article_body: Instagram Direct has been down for many users across the globe for over 12 hours, with users saying they have been unable to send messages. A user took to Twitter and wrote, "Why isn't there any statement on when the issue is going to get resolved?" "It's been 12 hours! How much time it'd need to restore," another user tweeted.

60.title: Important for Team India to have stable captain: Deep Dasgupta
60.article_body: After England levelled the five-match Test series 2-2 with a seven-wicket win over India, former India cricketer Deep Dasgupta said it's important to have a stable captain. "In the last few months...due to injury and other reasons, we had to shuffle between captains," he added. Notably, India captain Rohit Sharma has returned to the squad for England T20Is.

61.title: Biggest proof of honesty: Kejriwal on CAG report showing Delhi govt in profit
61.article_body: Speaking about the CAG report which stated that the Delhi government was running in profit, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that the numbers were the "biggest proof of its honesty". "This honesty has deprived our opponents of their sleep," Kejriwal added. The CAG report indicated that Delhi government's revenue receipts were sufficient to meet the revenue expenditure.

62.title: YSRCP MLA from Nellore enters drain to protest against sewage issues
62.article_body: YSRCP MLA from Nellore, Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy, protested against the officials for not resolving sewage issues in Umma Reddy Gunta by entering into sewage water on Tuesday. He said officials didn't listen to him despite several requests. He demanded the officials to give him in writing, a proper time frame for the work to be completed.

63.title: Hyderabad woman cheated of ₹39 lakh in 'KBC lottery’ fraud
63.article_body: Cyber fraudsters reportedly cheated a woman from Hyderabad of ₹39 lakh. They called her and said she has won 'KBC lottery' and made her pay ₹39 lakh fees as a part of the withdrawal process. When she realised she was cheated, the woman lodged a complaint. Police tracked the accused and arrested a man involved in the fraud from Patna.

64.title: British & their habit of distorting history: Mishra on Barmy Army's 'Eng win series' pic
64.article_body: Veteran leg-spinner Amit Mishra took to Twitter to criticise England's Barmy Army after they posted a picture that read, "England win series 1-0", following the fifth Test at Edgbaston. "Haash! British and their habit of distorting history for their own advantage," Mishra wrote. The series ended 2-2, with India having earlier taken a 2-1 lead after the first four matches.

65.title: US Independence Day parade shooter was dressed as a woman; pic surfaces
65.article_body: The shooter, who killed seven people at an Independence Day parade in US, dressed as a woman so that he could escape the scene of the mass shooting. Robert Crimo was arrested on Monday evening following an eight-hour manhunt and was charged with seven counts of first-degree murder on Tuesday. He was carrying an AR-15-style rifle.

66.title: I'd rather do films I'm proud of, okay if they don't make ₹100 cr: Rajkummar
66.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao said that it is okay if his films do not make ₹100 crore at the box office. "I [would] rather do films I can be proud of and not necessarily something that is working. As long as my producers don't lose money, I can keep telling stories...I don't want to be part of a herd," he added.

67.title: Man electrocuted to death in Kolkata; 3rd such incident in past 2 weeks
67.article_body: A 35-year-old man was electrocuted to death in Kolkata's Tangra area on Tuesday. According to reports, a minor fire broke out at Bunty Haldar's shop at around 9 am. However, when he tried to pull down the shop's iron shutter, he was electrocuted, police said. Notably, this is the third such incident in Kolkata in the past two weeks.

68.title: Bar body urges CJI to reject plea against SC remarks on Nupur
68.article_body: All India Bar Association wrote to CJI NV Ramana asking him to reject a letter petition seeking removal of Supreme Court’s recent remarks against suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma. “While engaging with counsel, it is natural for judges to open up and make observations and suggestions,” said AIBA. This comes after several former judges and bureaucrats condemned the court's remarks.

69.title: RBI to release Code of Conduct for digital lending by July-end: Report
69.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India will release the Code of Conduct for digital lending by the end of this month, ET Now reported citing sources. The guidelines will be applicable to all regulated entities including NBFCs and banks. Consumer consent will become mandatory for using data collected from users, the report added.

70.title: We're not doing anything illegal, ours is strong govt: Maha CM Shinde
70.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said, "We are not doing anything illegal." "There are rules, laws and Constitution and we've to work according to them," he added. Furthermore, he said, "Today, we've more than a 2/3rd majority, so our decision is legal." Shinde added, his government has the support of 170 MLAs and it’s a strong government.

71.title: Woman killed in landslide in Shimla, 4 feared washed away after flash flood in Kullu
71.article_body: A landslide on the outskirts of Shimla city left a woman dead and two others critically injured, an official said. At least four people were feared washed away in a flash flood triggered by a cloud burst in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district. Following the cloud burst at Chojh village at around 6 am, four to six people were missing.

72.title: Will not share US user data with China if asked: TikTok
72.article_body: TikTok in response to two US senators seeking an FTC probe into it due to "repeated misrepresentations" over its handling of US data, said, "TikTok has never shared US user data with the Chinese government, nor would we if asked." The senators' request followed a BuzzFeed report saying TikTok engineers and executives in China repeatedly access US users' private data.

73.title: Hyderabad civic body to build more than 35,000 2BHKs by March 2023
73.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has decided to complete the construction of 35,444 2BHKs by March 2023 under the Telangana government's double-bedroom housing scheme. Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao has instructed officials to formulate an action plan within a week for the distribution of the houses. Notably, the construction of 64,556 units has already been completed.

74.title: Mumbai man who abused police for waking him gets 1.7 yrs in jail
74.article_body: A  27-year-old labourer who abused a police constable when woken up at Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus' platform was sentenced to one year and seven months' imprisonment by a sessions court. Refusing to leave the platform, Panvel resident Rameshwar Rathoda abused the police and said, "Does this platform belong to your father...I will sleep here if I want to...Do whatever you want."

75.title: HC dismisses plea over property acquisition filed after delay of 62 yrs
75.article_body: Delhi HC dismissed a plea in connection with acquisition of property in Kalu Sarai after noting it was filed after a delay of 62 years. The plea sought dismissal of notifications of 1959 and 1960 issued under Land Acquisition Act, 1894. "Petitioners accepted...enhanced compensation without reserving any right...the law doesn't permit...to approbate and reprobate at the same time," HC said.

76.title: Suspect in US parade shooting charged with 7 counts of murder
76.article_body: A 21-year-old man accused of opening fire on US Independence Day parade in a Chicago suburb has been charged with seven counts of murder. The first-degree murder charges would be followed by "dozens of more charges", Lake County State Attorney Eric Rinehart said. The accused, who'd reportedly fired 70 rounds into the crowd, planned the attack for weeks, police said.

77.title: PM Modi calls up Tejashwi Yadav to enquire about Lalu Prasad Yadav's health
77.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Tejashwi Yadav to enquire about health of RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who fractured his shoulder after falling off stairs on Sunday. "The PM spoke to Tejashwi Yadav on Tuesday and enquired about the health of the RJD supremo. PM wished speedy recovery to RJD chief," RJD spokesperson (Bihar), said.

78.title: BJP filled with terrorists, it's top 2 afraid of AAP: Kejriwal
78.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal called BJP a party "filled with gundas, hooligans, rapists and terrorists". He noted that a terrorist recently arrested in Jammu and Kashmir was a "senior leader". "If you google 'rapist in BJP', you will find a long list of BJP leaders," he said. He also said that BJP's top two leaders are afraid of AAP.

79.title: Edtech startup AntWalk secures $7.5 million funding in Series A round
79.article_body: Bengaluru-based B2B edtech startup AntWalk has secured $7.5 million funding in a Series A round led by San Francisco-based venture capital firm GSV Ventures. Y Combinator and existing investor Matrix Partners India also participated in the round. The startup, which was founded in 2019, will use the newly-acquired funding to expand its customer base, among other things.

80.title: 5 Assamese-speaking Muslim groups get indigenous status in Assam
80.article_body: Assam cabinet granted indigenous status to five Assamese-speaking Muslim communities. "They are Goria, Moriya, Deshi, Julah and Syed...they will be categorised as Assamese Muslim sub-groups or indigenous Assamese Muslims," state Health Minister Keshab Mahanta said. This will ensure their development in health, education, skill development and women empowerment, CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said.

81.title: Not Bazball, it's what they normally do: Hussain on Root-Bairstow's stand
81.article_body: Talking about the unbeaten 269-run partnership between Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow in England's second innings of the fifth Test against India, ex-England captain Nasser Hussain said, "It's not really Bazball." "The way they...[played] is...what normal Root and Bairstow can do," added Hussain. Root scored an unbeaten 142 with Bairstow remaining unbeaten on 114, as England won by seven wickets.

82.title: India sees 16,159 new COVID-19 cases, 28 deaths; state-wise list of active cases released
82.article_body: India has reported 16,159 new COVID-19 cases and 28 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stands at 1,15,212, with the maximum active cases in Kerala (29,155), followed by Maharashtra (20,820) and Tamil Nadu (16,765). India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,25,270.

83.title: Part of me wanted India to get to 450 to see what we'd do: Stokes
83.article_body: After England recorded their highest-ever successful Test chase (378 runs), England captain Ben Stokes said he wanted India to set a target of 450 runs to see what they would do. "We knew we were always going to go out and try and chase that down," he added. England's Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow scored centuries in the fourth innings.

84.title: Female model from Brazil killed while fighting against Russia in Ukraine
84.article_body: A female model from Brazil, who received sniper training, has been killed while fighting against Russia in Ukraine. Thalita do Valle, who was killed in a Russian missile strike, took part in humanitarian missions around the world and had previously fought against ISIS in Iraq. The 39-year-old's brother described her as a hero.

85.title: England Cricket, Barmy Army troll Kohli after England's record run chase against India
85.article_body: England Cricket and Barmy Army trolled Virat Kohli after England recorded their highest successful Test run chase against India. England Cricket shared a picture of Kohli sledging Jonny Bairstow and a picture of seemingly disappointed Kohli embracing Bairstow after India's defeat. Barmy Army tweeted, "Bairstow has scored more runs in...last 25 days than Kohli has in the last 18 months."

86.title: I train everyday to play matches of this calibre: Jannik after match vs Djokovic
86.article_body: World number 13 Jannik Sinner, who had gone two sets up before losing to Novak Djokovic in their Wimbledon 2022 quarter-final, has said he's happy with his performance in the tournament. "I train every day to play matches of this calibre. I know I still have a lot to improve...[but] I think...I showed a good level of tennis," he stated.

87.title: Fewer judges, absence of infra increasing pendency of cases: CJI
87.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana said that pendency of cases is "intensifying" in India due to absence of adequate infrastructure and sufficient number of judges with the increasing workload. He said that he has been reminding the government to expedite the process of filling up vacancies. "I am hoping for some forward movement in this regard," he added.

88.title: Canada to throw out 1.36 crore AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine doses
88.article_body: Canada will throw out around 1.36 crore doses of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine that have expired. "Due to limited demand for the vaccine and recipient country challenges with distribution and absorption, they were not accepted," said Health Canada in a statement. The country had procured 2 crore doses from AstraZeneca, but later focused on using Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccines.

89.title: Aamir is not Punjabi, could have done better with accent in 'Laal...': Sargun
89.article_body: Actress Sargun Mehta said actor Aamir Khan is not Punjabi and he could have done better with Punjabi accent in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Whatever he has done in the film, it takes a lot to get the results. He has...worked really hard," she said, adding, "If Aamir would have [used] pure Punjabi...nobody could have understood."

90.title: We'll fight for it, protest & go to court: AIMIM leader on renaming of Aurangabad
90.article_body: Days after Maharashtra Cabinet approved renaming of Aurangabad to Sambhaji Nagar, AIMIM leader Imtiaz Jaleel on Tuesday said the residents, whichever religion they may be from, feel connected to the name. "No one wants the name to change. We'll fight for it in any way possible...stage protests, go to court and raise our voice in Parliament," he added.

91.title: TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan granted bail over misleading video on Rahul Gandhi
91.article_body: TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan, who was arrested by Noida Police on Tuesday over misleading clips on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, was released on bail. He was released on bail as the sections against him are bailable offences, police said. Ranjan had purportedly misquoted Gandhi's statements on vandalism at his Wayanad office and linked it to the Udaipur tailor's murder.

92.title: Ajmer Dargah Khadim offers his house to anyone who beheads Nupur Sharma, arrested
92.article_body: Salman Chishti, Khadim of Ajmer Dargah, who announced to give away his house and property in a video to reward anyone who beheads former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma for her comments against the Prophet has been arrested. Police said that Salman Chishti is a history-sheeter and it was found that he made the video in an inebriated state.

93.title: Russia passes bill for stricter fines on foreign tech firms with no office
93.article_body: Russian lawmakers have passed a bill for stricter penalties for foreign internet companies that fail to open an office in Russia, including fines. Last year, Russian communications regulator Roskomnadzor listed 13 companies, mostly based in the US, required to set up offices by the end of the year. Russia has recently acted against several tech firms, including Meta and Twitter.

94.title: BJP supported us for our 'Hindutva position', development agenda: Maha CM
94.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has said that the Shiv Sena MLAs who revolted against Uddhav Thackeray's government had taken a "Hindutva position". Shinde said BJP supported them for their Hindutva and agenda of development. "And they (BJP) supported us despite having more numbers, more MLAs," Shinde told ANI, adding that Devendra Fadnavis became Deputy Chief Minister showing a "big heart".

95.title: Eknath Shinde backstabbed me: Former Maha CM Uddhav Thackeray
95.article_body: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday said Eknath Shinde, who led the rebellion with party MLAs to bring down Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government, backstabbed him. "Shinde to whom I have given the responsibility of the party backstabbed me," Thackeray said. "It's painful to see...those who won due to Sena workers and got everything have left," he added.

96.title: BJP planning to convert Delhi into full UT, scrap polls: Kejriwal
96.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said there are "talks" that the Centre may dissolve Delhi Assembly and convert Delhi into a full Union Territory (UT). "The BJP leaders are now threatening that there will be no next election in Delhi...by making Delhi a full Union Territory (UT)," Kejriwal said. "By hating Kejriwal, you've started hating the country," he added.

97.title: Skills can take you places: Scaler
97.article_body: Edtech startup, Scaler, highlights the importance of building real skills to take a leap in one's tech career. A structured curriculum, taught by industry experts, prepares engineers for tech roles at top companies, said Scaler. Learners get solid career advice on how to create an impact in the tech world, from mentors who've been there, it added.

98.title: UK signs 1st international data sharing deal post Brexit
98.article_body: UK has entered into an agreement with South Korea under which organisations of both the countries will be able to share data across the borders without restrictions, the government said. This is UK's first international data adequacy agreement post Brexit. UK Data Minister Julia Lopez said, "[It] will enable more vital research that can improve the lives of people."

99.title: 15-year-old missing boy found murdered in Pune; 3 minors arrested
99.article_body: A 15-year-old boy was found murdered on Tuesday in Pune, a day after he went missing. As per police, the victim and five other minors had gathered in Moshi for a party on Monday. During the party, they'd heated arguments which allegedly led to the murder. Three minors have been arrested and they've confessed to the killing, the police said.

100.title: Man who said 'Jesus is supreme' gets death sentence for blasphemy in Pak
100.article_body: A Christian mechanic who said, "Jesus is supreme" during an argument with a customer was handed a death sentence in Pakistan. The man, Ashfaq Masih, was booked and arrested in 2017 after he refused to give a discount to the customer for his services. The crowd, which gathered after the argument broke out, accused Masih of disrespecting Prophet Muhammad.

101.title: When will you ask police to issue lookout notice for Mahua?: BJP MLA to Mamata
101.article_body: Following TMC's Mahua Moitra's remark that to her, "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess", BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari asked, "Honourable CM Mamata Banerjee, when will you ask Kolkata Police to issue lookout notice for Mahua Moitra for insulting goddess maa Kaali?" "Why do you and your party leaders reserve all the abusive remarks for Hindu deities?" he asked.

102.title: E-challan helps Mumbai woman find bag she left in autorickshaw
102.article_body: A 61-year-old Mumbai-based woman, who left a bag containing valuables worth ₹5 lakh in an autorickshaw, found it back with help of e-challan. She got off at her destination in hurry due to heavy rain. Realising that she left the bag in autorickshaw she rushed to RCF Police Station where the police detected the vehicle number with help of e-challan.

103.title: Reports claim Dhaakad producer sold office to repay loans, he says 'Absolutely wrong'
103.article_body: Kangana Ranaut-starrer Dhaakad's producer Deepak Mukut has rubbished reports that claimed that he sold his office to repay dues and loans because the film failed at the box office. Mukut clarified, "These are baseless rumours and absolutely wrong. I have already recovered maximum loss and whatever is left will be recovered in the due course."

104.title: Difficult for Vihari, Sarfaraz is waiting: Jaffer on changes in Test squad
104.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has called for Ranji Trophy 2022 top-scorer Sarfaraz Khan's inclusion in India's Test squad in place of Hanuma Vihari, who scored a total of 31 runs in the rescheduled fifth Test against England. "Sarfaraz has been in really good form in the Ranji Trophy and should be given an opportunity," stated Jaffer.

105.title: Domestic LPG cylinder rate increased by ₹50 from today
105.article_body: The price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder has been increased by ₹50 with effect from Wednesday, July 6. A domestic LPG cylinder will now cost ₹1,053 in Delhi and ₹1,052.50 in Mumbai. The price of a 5-kg domestic cylinder was also increased by ₹18, however, the price of a 19-kg commercial cylinder was cut by ₹8.50.

106.title: Nadhim Zahawi made UK Finance Minister after Rishi Sunak resigns
106.article_body: Nadhim Zahawi has been appointed as UK Finance Minister after Rishi Sunak resigned from the post. Sunak said that his approach to running the economy was "fundamentally too different" from PM Boris Johnson's. Meanwhile, Steve Barclay has been appointed Health Secretary after resignation of Sajid Javid, who said he had lost confidence in Johnson's ability to govern in national interest.

107.title: Transported to 1947, couldn't believe we recreated Partition: 'Ms..' director
107.article_body: 'Ms Marvel' director Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy said that there were close to 1,000 extras on the set in the scene about the 1947 Partition. "There was a moment when all of us on set couldn't believe that we were able to recreate Partition...For that time we were filming her walking through that platform, we...really were transported into 1947," she added.

108.title: Relationships in Bollywood are 'very seasonal': Karan Johar
108.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said relationships in Bollywood are "very seasonal" based on work commitments, adding that people fall off the radar but want to jump back "very conveniently". "I don't believe in seasonal relationships," he stated. Talking about his show 'Koffee with Karan', Karan said there were times when he was "perplexed" and "shocked" about his guests being very boring.

109.title: Justify decision to register Binance unit: French MEP to regulator
109.article_body: French MEP Aurore Lalucq has asked the market regulator to justify its "incomprehensible" decision to register a Binance unit as a digital assets service provider. Lalucq cited a Reuters investigation into money laundering on the platform as a basis for her concerns. She also mentioned Britain's financial regulator said Binance was "not capable of being effectively supervised".

110.title: Laid-off Tesla US workers file plea, allege small severance pay
110.article_body: Two laid-off Tesla US workers have filed an emergency motion alleging far less severance than legally required. The workers were among more than 500 workers laid off in Nevada. The motion stated that Tesla has been asking employees to agree to release it of all claims, in exchange for severance of just one or two weeks' pay and benefits.

111.title: 35-yr-old religious leader from Afghanistan shot dead in Nashik
111.article_body: A 35-year-old religious leader from Afghanistan was shot dead in the Yeola town of Maharashtra's Nashik on Tuesday, said police. A group of four unidentified persons carried out the deed, the motive of which was not immediately known, at an open plot. The victim, identified as Khwaja Sayyad Chishti, was popularly known as 'Sufi Baba' in the town.

112.title: NIA questions Bihar man in Hyderabad over Udaipur tailor's murder
112.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Tuesday questioned a 36-year-old man from Bihar living in Hyderabad's Kalandar Nagar in connection with beheading of a tailor, Kanhaiya Lal, in Rajasthan's Udaipur. The man was reportedly served a notice by NIA to appear for enquiry in Jaipur on July 14. Lal was murdered by two men for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma.

113.title: 2-yr-old boy found wandering alone at US shooting site after both parents killed
113.article_body: A two-year-old boy was found wandering alone after the mass shooting at a US Independence Day parade in Chicago. The parents of the child named Aiden McCarthy were among seven people killed in the massacre, police officials said. The child's image from the shooting site surfaced on social media before police handed him over to his grandparents.

114.title: We have to reflect why we aren't able to bat well in 3rd innings: Dravid
114.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid has said they will review the failure of batters in the third innings of recent overseas Test matches. "We have to reflect why we aren't able to bat well in the third innings...and why we aren't able to take 10 wickets in the fourth innings," he stated. India have lost their last three overseas Tests.

115.title: 4 held for killing 17-yr-old boy, burying body in Delhi's Central Ridge
115.article_body: At least four men were arrested for allegedly kidnapping a 17-year-old boy, stabbing him to death and burying his body in Delhi's Central Ridge, police said. The accused burned the victim's and their own clothes to avoid identification and arrest, police added. The victim and his friends had allegedly assaulted one of the four accused on June 29, police stated.

116.title: Won't do sports films as I'm almost forgetting I'm an actor: Taapsee
116.article_body: Taapsee Pannu said she has decided not to act in sports films because she is almost forgetting that she is an actress. "[I've] done so many back-to-back sports films...People keep approaching me for sports biopics," added Taapsee. Taapsee will be next seen in her upcoming film 'Shabaash Mithu' which is a biopic on ex-Indian women's cricket team captain Mithali Raj.

117.title: Cell therapy cancer treatment facility being set up in B'luru, trials on
117.article_body: A cell therapy facility for cancer treatment is being set up in Mazumdar Shaw Medical Centre at Narayana Hrudayalaya Health City in Bengaluru. The team working on it is reportedly trying to bring down cost of the therapy from the current $4,00,000 to $3,50,000. "The clinical trial has already started, and we have dosed several patients," Dr Siddhartha Mukherjee said.

118.title: Delhi to get moderate rainfall on Thursday, 'orange' alert issued
118.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an 'orange' alert in Delhi for Thursday with the possibility of moderate rainfall. Thursday's rainfall is expected to bring a drop in the maximum temperature by three to four degrees, IMD scientist RK Jenamani said. According to IMD's seven-day forecast, Delhi has a 'yellow' alert for rainfall activity each day till July 11.

119.title: Worker kidnaps employer’s son over non-payment of wages; arrested in Thane
119.article_body: Panvel Police arrested a 35-year-old labourer from Thane's Bhiwandi for allegedly kidnapping his employer's 11-year-old son over non-payment of his wages of ₹8,000. The accused had reportedly demanded a ransom of ₹30,000 from his employer. "With [him], I had an understanding that after...completion of the work, I would pay his wages...Yet, he decided to abduct my son," the employer said.

120.title: B'luru reports 775 new COVID-19 cases; active cases stand at 5,988
120.article_body: Bengaluru reported 775 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, taking the number of active cases in the city to 5,988, according to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike figures. No new coronavirus-related deaths were reported in Bengaluru in the last 24 hours and the positivity rate is at 5.08%, the data showed. The number of active clusters in the city is currently 28.

121.title: Potential Omicron sub-variant of COVID-19 reported from India & 10 countries: WHO
121.article_body: There has been an emergence of a potential Omicron sub-variant referred to as BA.2.75, first reported from India and then from 10 other countries, said the WHO. This sub-variant seems to have a few mutations on the receptor-binding domain of the spike protein, the WHO added. It's too early to know if this sub-variant is clinically more severe, it added.

122.title: What is the new cricketing term 'Bazball'?
122.article_body: The term 'Bazball' is named after England head coach Brendon McCullum. It essentially means an aggressive approach towards scoring quick runs even in Test cricket. 'Bazball' is designed to entertain and try to win matches and not draw them. England chased down targets of 277, 299 and 296 in 78.5, 50 and 54.2 overs, respectively against New Zealand.

123.title: I don't know what it is: Rahul Dravid as reporter asks 'What is your take on Bazball?'
123.article_body: After a reporter asked him about his take on 'Bazball', Team India head coach Rahul Dravid said, "I don't know what it is." Further talking about England's approach in Test cricket, Dravid said, "I'd definitely say the kind of cricket they have been playing in the last few months has been really good. They have been really good at chasing."

124.title: IAF gets 7.5 lakh applications under Agnipath, closes registration
124.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) said it has received nearly 7.5 lakh applications for recruitment under the Agnipath scheme. The registrations, which started on June 24, were closed on Tuesday. "Compared to 6,31,528 applications in the past, which was the highest in any recruitment cycle, this time 7,49,899 applications have been received," said IAF.

125.title: Ola may lay off 400-500 employees to cut costs: Report
125.article_body: Ola is looking at cutting its costs which could result in it laying off around 400-500 employees, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. "Key managers were asked to draw up a list of people from their respective teams last week who can be let go," a source was quoted as saying. It has also stopped investments in overseas markets where it's present.

126.title: 5th electric bus depot started in Pune, 28 charging points operational
126.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) has started its fifth e-depot for charging and maintenance of e-buses in the city. The new depot has been started at the Pune Railway Station. Reports said that 25 buses will be charged at this e-depot in the first phase and that 28 charging points are already operational.

127.title: 892 prisoners released on parole across Maha during COVID didn’t return
127.article_body: As many as 892 prisoners of the 4,241 convicts lodged across 46 prisons in Maharashtra, who were released on COVID emergency parole, have reportedly not returned to jail. Many of these prisoners have been convicted of various serious crimes, like murder, attempt to murder etc. Prison department has lodged 86 FIRs against such absconding criminals and police are hunting them.

128.title: Canada museum apologises after India's statement on poster showing goddess Kali smoking
128.article_body: After Indian High Commission in Canada's statement on poster showing goddess Kali smoking, the Aga Khan Museum on Tuesday apologised. "The museum deeply regrets that one of the 18 short videos from 'Under the Tent' and its accompanying social media post have inadvertently caused offence to members of the Hindu and other faith communities," the museum's statement read.

129.title: 2 men drown in water-filled quarry in Mumbai's Dahisar, 1 body recovered
129.article_body: Two men drowned in a water-filled quarry in Mumbai's Dahisar on Tuesday evening. While the body of a 19-year-old youth has been found and identified, the authorities are still searching for the other person. According to police, a group of seven young men had entered the quarry at around 5:30 pm on Tuesday when the two of them drowned.

130.title: PMC yet to recover ₹9.20 cr fine for 92,126 illegal hoardings across Pune
130.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation is yet to recover ₹9.20 crore fine from violators for putting up illegal banners and hoardings across city from April 1, 2021 to June 30, 2022. Officials said fine for 92,126 boards has not been collected. PMC can, according to BPMC Act, recover ₹50,000 from an illegal advertisement board and impose fine of ₹5,000 per illegal hoarding.

131.title: 6-year-old boy falls into water-filled lift duct in Thane, dies
131.article_body: A six-year-old boy died after falling into a water-filled lift duct in an under-construction building in Thane's Dombivali on Tuesday, a police official said. The boy, identified as Vedant Jadhav, had gone missing at around 11:30 am. An investigation revealed that he fell into the duct while trying to retrieve the ball with which he was playing, the official added.

132.title: Nanded-Pune Daily Express train commences operation
132.article_body: The South Central Railway's Nanded-Pune Daily Express train has commenced operations. Raosaheb Patil Danve, Minister of State of Railways and Coal and Mines, flagged off the inaugural service from Jalna railway station on July 4. The train, which will start and terminate in Pune, will cover a distance of approximately 650 km in 14 hours and have 11 stoppages.

133.title: Iran has added unrelated demands for nuclear deal: US Special Envoy
133.article_body: Iran has added demands that have "nothing to do with the nuclear deal", US envoy appointed to revive the 2015 nuclear deal said. Special envoy Robert Malley also said that Iran has made significant progress in Uranium enrichment. Iran was offered relaxations in sanctions if it returned into compliance of the 2015 deal within a provided timeline, he added.

134.title: BharatPe disburses over ₹3,600 crore loans in Q1 FY23, up 112% QoQ
134.article_body: BharatPe on Tuesday said it disbursed over ₹3,600 crore loans to more than 1.2 lakh merchants in Q1 FY23. While disbursements recorded 112% quarter-on-quarter growth, the merchant beneficiary count grew nearly 82% from the January-March quarter, it stated. BharatPe also said that its annualised total payment value (TPV) hit an all-time high of $18.5 billion, an over 50% QoQ rise.

135.title: Complete pending tasks to decongest 77 traffic corridors: Delhi LG
135.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has told all concerned agencies to complete their pending tasks so as to decongest 77 traffic corridors and improve traffic flow in the national capital. Agencies including the PWD and DDA have been given three months to complete all the pending work. The LG also asked the Chief Secretary to sort all pending departmental issues.

136.title: Chargesheet filed against suspended IAS officer in MNREGA scam
136.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has filed a chargesheet against suspended IAS officer Pooja Singhal who was arrested for allegedly embezzling MGNREGA funds in Khunti district of Jharkhand. Singhal was arrested on May 11 and her bail hearing is on July 12. The ED has reportedly recovered nearly ₹20 crore from Singhal.

137.title: China sees record rain, extreme heat in June
137.article_body: China is witnessing extreme weather patterns, recording above average rain and heat levels in the same month. This year, northeastern provinces received their highest-ever rainfall recorded in June. The national rainfall average for June was 112.1 mm, 9.1% higher than last year. Contrastingly, the average temperature nationwide was 21.3°C this month, 0.9°C higher than the same period last year.

138.title: India, Iran discuss Chabahar Port progress, situation in Afghanistan
138.article_body: India's Foreign Secretary Vinay Kwatra and Iran's Deputy PM for Political Affairs Dr Ali Bagheri Kani held a telephonic discussion on Tuesday and reviewed the progress of the Chabahar Port. The two sides also discussed the situation in Afghanistan and deliberated on other regional and global issues. Various elements of the India-Iran bilateral relations were discussed, the MEA said.

139.title: Mithun Chakraborty should apologise to Mamata Banerjee: TMC leader
139.article_body: TMC leader Kunal Ghosh criticised actor and BJP leader Mithun Chakraborty and asked him to apologise to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. "When Didi nominated him for Rajya Sabha, he said that he will never forget the gesture of Mamata Banerjee. Then he...backstabbed Didi," Ghosh said. Ghosh's comment came after the BJP leader's visit to Kolkata after a year.

140.title: 25-yr-old Army jawan drowns while bathing in river Ganga in U'khand
140.article_body: Police said that a 25-year-old Army jawan, Nitul Yadav, drowned while bathing in river Ganga near Uttarakhand's Rishikesh on Tuesday. Yadav was part of a group of six members who had gone to bathe in the river near Lakshman Jhoola, they added. Suddenly, water levels rose and he was swept away by the strong currents, police said.

141.title: Number of transgender voters rise in Thane municipal polls
141.article_body: The number of transgender voters registered with the Thane Municipal Corporation has increased by over six-times, according to data released by the civic body. In 2017, there were 15 transgender voters, which has now increased to 108. The Thane civic polls will be held later this year. Overall, 13.9 lakh ballots are expected to be cast.

142.title: Norwegian oil and gas workers go on strike amid gas shortage
142.article_body: Amid the shortage of Russian gas in Europe due to the conflict in Ukraine, Norwegian oil and gas workers went on a strike on Tuesday, the Lederne union confirmed. Workers are demanding pay raise to compensate for rising inflation. Norway's largest gas producer, Equinor, on Tuesday confirmed it had initiated a shutdown of three oil fields due to the strike.

143.title: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak resigns citing Boris Johnson's leadership
143.article_body: The UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak, along with Health Secretary Sajid Javid, tendered his resignation on Tuesday, citing Prime Minister Boris Johnson's leadership. "I recognise this may be my last ministerial job, but I believe these standards are worth fighting for," Sunak said. Meanwhile, Javid said that he can no longer continue to serve his role in good conscience.

144.title: I'm not admitted to hospital, I'm fine: Shruti on rumours about her health
144.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan shared a video on Instagram, dismissing all speculations regarding her health issues with PCOS. She said, "Just wanted to clarify...I am [not] unwell...I've realised..some media outlets have blown it way out of proportion." "I also got calls today asking if I am admitted to the hospital, which I am clearly not. I'm doing perfectly fine," she added.

145.title: CAA will be implemented before 2024 Lok Sabha polls: WB BJP chief
145.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar on Tuesday said that the Citizenship (Amendment) Act or CAA will be implemented before the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "BJP has a track record of keeping its promises," Sukanta Majumdar said. "We had promised to build Ram Mandir, we have done it. CAA is our goal and we will achieve it," he added.

146.title: Autorickshaw outpaced Mercedes car: Maha CM Shinde on Uddhav
146.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday took a jibe at Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray and said that an autorickshaw has outpaced a Mercedes car. Shinde, whose rebellion led to the downfall of the MVA government in Maharashtra, was referred to as an "autorickshaw driver" by some Sena leaders when he was leading the revolt.

147.title: Israel PM to convey country's stance on Iran nuclear talks to France
147.article_body: Israeli PM Yair Lapid on Tuesday left for France where he said he will convey Israel's position regarding the current nuclear talks, between Iran and world powers, to the French President. "It's important our voice be heard...against this dangerous deal," Lapid told reporters. "We don't oppose a deal. We seek a very strong deal," an aide of Lapid said.

148.title: It bothers me, I don't like injustice: David Warner's wife on his lifetime leadership ban
148.article_body: Australia opener David Warner's wife Candice Warner said the lifetime leadership ban imposed on her husband by Cricket Australia for his role in ball-tampering scandal still bothers her. "I don't like injustice...so it does bother me," she stated. Candice stated, "It doesn't really bother him because he can go and captain in UAE, he can go and captain in India."

149.title: Russian lower house passes bills on war economy measures
149.article_body: Amid the conflict in Ukraine, the Russian parliament's lower house on Tuesday passed two bills, one of which would allow the government to compel businesses to provide goods to the military. The second bill would authorise the government to regulate working hours in such companies. Workers could be compelled to work at night, on weekends, and without annual leave.

150.title: Vote against annual reporting on harassment: Tesla Board to shareholders
150.article_body: Tesla's Board of Directors has recommended shareholders to vote against a proposal regarding annual reporting on anti-harassment and discrimination efforts taken by the company for its employees, as per a US SEC filing. The Board's existing policies "effectively address" the issues, the document said. Tesla is facing 10 lawsuits alleging racial discrimination or sexual harassment in the US.

151.title: Haryana has become stronghold of criminals: Cong's Hooda
151.article_body: The law and order situation in Haryana has completely collapsed under the BJP-JJP government and the state has become a stronghold of criminals, Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda said on Tuesday. No one is safe in the state, neither the common man nor an MLA, he said. He added that three MLAs have received threats within a week.

152.title: Rihanna becomes youngest self-made billionaire woman in US at 34
152.article_body: Rihanna has become the youngest self-made billionaire woman in US, as per Forbes. The 34-year-old has a net worth of $1.4 billion. She was ranked 21st overall in 'America's Richest Self-Made Women' list and is the only billionaire under 40 on the list. After Rihanna, the next-youngest billionaire on Forbes' list is 41-year-old Kim Kardashian, with $1.8 billion net worth.

153.title: What multiple records were broken during England-India Edgbaston Test?
153.article_body: England recorded their highest-ever successful Test chase (378 runs) against India in Edgbaston Test. Rishabh Pant scored most runs in an overseas Test by an India wicketkeeper (203). Stuart Broad set the record for conceding most runs in an over in a Test (35), while Jasprit Bumrah scored the most runs in an over in a Test (29).

154.title: Joe Root's 'pinky finger' celebration after smashing his 28th Test hundred goes viral
154.article_body: A video of former England captain Joe Root's 'pinky finger' celebration after smashing his 28th hundred in Test cricket has gone viral. After reaching the three-figure mark against India in England's second innings in the Edgbaston Test, Root was seen pointing his pinky finger towards the England dressing room. Root has now hit nine Test tons against India.

155.title: Delhi Police starts registering Kanwariyas ahead of Kanwar Yatra
155.article_body: Delhi Police has started the registration of the Kanwariyas who are going to take part in the Kanwar Yatra. The registration process, which began on July 5, will help in making the yatra safe and easy for the Kanwariyas and enable authorities to provide quick aid, the police said. The Kanwar Yatra is scheduled to begin on July 14.

156.title: 8 injured in mass shooting at a park in US' Minneapolis
156.article_body: Eight people were injured in a mass shooting at Boom Island Park in US' Minneapolis during unofficial American Independence Day celebrations on Monday, according to officials. "We were just watching fireworks and we just heard a whole bunch of shots," a witness said. No immediate arrest was made after the shooting incident, according to the police.

157.title: Negotiations with IMF for bailout are complicated, says Sri Lanka PM
157.article_body: Sri Lanka's talks with the International Monetary Fund for a bailout package are complicated as it is a bankrupt nation, said Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe. Sri Lanka is currently experiencing its worst economic crisis, with massive shortage of essential goods and its foreign exchange levels falling drastically. Citizens have hit the streets to protest against the government.

158.title: Indonesian school helps deaf students recite Quran in sign language
158.article_body: A school in Indonesia's Yogyakarta is teaching students with hearing impairments how to recite the Quran in sign language. The Darul A'shom school, which opened in 2019, has 12 staff members and 115 students aged 7-28 years. Only three out of 10 children with disabilities in Indonesia are able to go to school, a UNICEF survey has shown.

159.title: I don't have the guts to get a cosmetic surgery done: Alaya F
159.article_body: During an Ask Me Anything session on Instagram, actress Alaya F was asked whether she has done any cosmetic surgery. To which, she responded, "No, I haven't. Nothing at all. I've thought about it but I've realised...I don't have the guts. I think I'll thank myself later on if I don't." "I don't think I ever will," she added.

160.title: I hope Shamshera gives me the wings to fly high: Director Karan Malhotra
160.article_body: Speaking about his film 'Shamshera', director Karan Malhotra said, "Hopefully, Shamshera gives me the wings to fly and fly high." "I hope, I get the opportunity to do these films. Nobody can predict the future and for every filmmaker, it's about falling in love with that one idea, which can be anything. Right now, I'm enjoying this space," he added.

161.title: Huge scam in Dalit Bandhu beneficiaries' selection: T'gana Cong MP
161.article_body: Telangana Congress MP N Uttam Kumar Reddy on Tuesday alleged a huge scam in the Dalit Bandhu scheme and demanded a probe. "More than poor Dalits, the scheme is proving to be an income scheme for TRS leaders," Reddy said. He said many Dalit families were being forced to pay commission for their selection as a beneficiary of the scheme.

162.title: Tamil Nadu waiting for an 'Eknath Shinde' to emerge: BJP's Annamalai
162.article_body: After rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde-led new government was formed in Maharashtra, BJP's Tamil Nadu President K Annamalai said that Tamil Nadu is also waiting for an 'Eknath Shinde' to emerge. "Just like how...Eknath Shinde sprung up in...Shiv Sena, Tamil Nadu Cabinet headed by DMK leader MK Stalin is also...waiting for an Eknath Shinde to emerge," he said.

163.title: 3 given life term for abduction and murder of 14-yr-old in Punjab
163.article_body: The district court in Punjab's Kapurthala on Monday awarded life imprisonment to three individuals for the kidnapping and murder of a 14-year-old boy in 2016. One of the convicts is a cousin of the deceased victim, the prosecution informed. The convicts had conspired to demand a ransom of ₹30 lakhs from the boy's father, a local industrialist, the prosecution added.

164.title: Navy's INS Satpura participates in 'Rim of the Pacific' exercise
164.article_body: Indian Navy's frigate INS Satpura and a P8I aircraft are participating in this year's 'Rim of the Pacific' naval exercise, known as the largest international maritime warfare exercise. After conclusion of the ongoing harbour phase of the exercise, the sea phase will commence on July 12. Navies of 26 countries are participating in this year's exercise.

165.title: 6-year-old falls into water-filled lift duct in Maharashtra, dies
165.article_body: A six-year-old boy died after falling into a water-filled lift duct in Maharashtra, a police official said. The boy, Vedant Jadhav, had gone missing at 11:30 am and an investigation found him in the lift duct which was in an under-construction building in Thane's Dombivali area. Jadhav had gone to retrieve his ball that he was playing with.

166.title: Turkey's annual inflation at 78.62%; highest in 24 years
166.article_body: Turkey's annual inflation was 78.62% at the end of June - the highest rate in over two decades, according to data released by Turkish Statistical Institute. Consumer prices increased by 4.95% on a monthly comparison. The worst hit sectors were transportation, food and beverage where annual prices surged by 123.37% and 93.93% respectively. Critics blame government policies for the situation.

167.title: Madhavan shares AR Rahman's reaction to Rocketry, says 'Unforgettable moments'
167.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Madhavan shared a video from the premiere of his directorial debut 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' at the Cannes Film Festival. In the video, AR Rahman praised Madhavan as a director. "What a direction. Every dialogue was great," Rahman could be heard telling Madhavan. Reacting to his appreciation, Madhavan tweeted, "Unforgettable moments of my life...@arrahman sir...Thank you."

168.title: I hope Tesla doesn't need to enter mining industry: Elon Musk
168.article_body: Elon Musk said he hopes that Tesla does not need to enter the mining industry owing to its limitations. Speaking on the Getting Stoned podcast, Musk took the example of lithium and said that to make lithium-ion batteries, the refining process to achieve lithium's purity can be a chokepoint. Tesla would rather focus its talent on sustainability transition, Musk added.

169.title: Mamata's security increased; police at secretariat can't use phone
169.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's security has been increased days after a man sneaked into her residence despite presence of a large number of police personnel. The state government has also decided that police personnel posted at the state secretariat can't use mobile phones during duty hours. The police personnel will have to deposit their mobile phones before joining duty.

170.title: Tata Motors' disqualification from BEST's bid upheld by Bombay HC
170.article_body: The Bombay HC upheld the Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport Undertaking's (BEST Undertaking) decision to disqualify Tata Motors from a tender bid for supplying 1,400 e-buses. It said BEST was right to disqualify Tata Motors for being "technically unresponsive". However, it also held the winning bidder, Evey Trans, as "non-responsive" and directed BEST to call for fresh bids, if required.

171.title: Djokovic registers 215-minute 5-set comeback win, reaches his 11th Wimbledon semis
171.article_body: Six-time Wimbledon champion Novak Djokovic registered a comeback victory after losing first two sets against Italian tennis player Jannik Sinner in the Wimbledon 2022 men's singles quarter-finals. Djokovic won the match with a scoreline of 5-7, 2-6, 6-3, 6-2, 6-2 in 215 minutes. With this, Djokovic entered the Wimbledon semi-finals for the 11th time in his career.

172.title: 'Startup founder' most searched keyword on Shaadi.com, not IAS or IPS: MoS IT
172.article_body: Minister of State (MoS) for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar at a recent event said he has been informed by reliable sources that the most searched keyword on Shaadi.com now is 'startup employee' or 'startup founder'. "It's not IAS, not IPS...not Tata company or Birla company," he added. "What better judge of what is a successful career than Shaadi.com," Chandrasekhar further said.

173.title: Nepotism will always be there in the film industry: Rajkummar Rao
173.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao has stated that nepotism will always be there in the film industry, adding that your work and talent will speak.
