He further said that he has friends who were his classmates but are getting recognition now because of OTT platforms. "Jaideep (Ahlawat) who did so well in 'Paatal Lok' and Pratik (Gandhi) in 'Scam 1992'," Rajkummar added.

174.title: 3 people burn to death after collision between trucks in Jodhpur
174.article_body: Three people were burnt to death after a head-on collision between two trucks in Jodhpur's Shergarh area during late hours of Monday, police said on Tuesday. The collision triggered a fire in the fuel tank of one of the trucks, they added. The drivers of the trucks and an assistant were killed after getting trapped in the fire, police informed.

175.title: I express my deep regret: Kerala minister on anti-Constitution remarks
175.article_body: Kerala minister Saji Cherian on Tuesday expressed "deep regret" for his controversial statements criticising the Constitution, saying his remarks were "misinterpreted". "I respect our Constitution...The news that I criticised the Constitution is twisted," he added. Earlier today, Cherian had said that the Indian Constitution was written in a way that can be used to "exploit" people.

176.title: I'm not afraid of failing: Bairstow after twin tons vs India in 5th Test
176.article_body: After scoring 106 and 114* in England's seven-wicket win against India in rescheduled fifth Test, England batter Jonny Bairstow said he's not afraid of failing. "I just have an enjoyment factor now...just want to put pressure on the opposition," he added. Chasing 378, Bairstow and Joe Root added 269-run partnership for fourth wicket. Bairstow was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

177.title: Trying to rewrite how Test cricket is played in Eng: Stokes on 5th Test win
177.article_body: After England levelled the five-match series 2-2 with a seven-wicket win over India, England captain Ben Stokes said, "When the lads play like this, it makes my job easier." He added, "When you have clarity like we have in the dressing room, it makes chasing totals like this [378] easier...we're trying to rewrite how Test cricket is played in England."

178.title: No praise high enough for these two: Jaffer on Bairstow and Root
178.article_body: Praising Joe Root(142*) and Jonny Bairstow(106, 114*) following their centuries in the rescheduled fifth Test against India, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "No praise high enough for these two! Root is the best test batter right now, but the way Bairstow rose to the challenge in both innings was superb. You just got to doff your hat and say well played."

179.title: OPS seeks Jaishankar's aid for rescue of 12 Indian fishermen
179.article_body: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) leader O Panneerselvam has requested the aid of External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar for release of 12 Indian fishermen captured by the Sri Lankan Navy. The Sri Lankan Navy arrested the fisherfolk for allegedly fishing in the country's territorial waters. Of the arrested fishermen, seven are from Tamil Nadu and five from Puducherry.

180.title: Bomb blast kills 2 UN peacekeepers, injures 5 others in Mali
180.article_body: Two United Nations peacekeepers were killed and five others severely wounded after a convoy was hit by an improvised explosive device in Mali on Tuesday, the UN peacekeeping mission, MINUSMA, said. A rapid intervention force was sent to the scene and the injured were evacuated, it added. The attack may constitute a war crime under international law, it further said.

181.title: Haryana to provide free health facilities to HIV positive patients
181.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar has approved a proposal to provide free health facilities such as radiological and laboratory tests to HIV positive patients. The free health facilities are being provided under the Public Private Partnership mode, which currently includes seven categories. Currently, around 22,000 HIV patients in the state are taking Antiretroviral Therapy (ART).

182.title: European Parliament passes two laws to regulate Big Tech dominance
182.article_body: The European Parliament has passed the Digital Markets Act (DMA) and the Digital Services Act (DSA) which will help control the dominance of companies such as Apple, Amazon, Facebook, Google and Microsoft. While the DMA targets monopolisation in the digital markets, the DSA bans targeted advertising aimed at children or based on sensitive data. Companies will face fines for violations.

183.title: BJP could sense growing discontent among Sena MLAs: Fadnavis
183.article_body: Deputy CM of Maharashtra Devendra Fadnavis asserted that BJP could sense the growing discontent among the Shiv Sena legislators for the last three to four months. "They were reeling under a lack of leadership. So, we waited for the opportunity and then made our masterstroke," he said. Maharashtra will see new heights of prosperity under CM Eknath Shinde, he added.

184.title: Govt releases list of states/UTs best in implementing National Food Security Act
184.article_body: Centre released the first State Ranking Index for implementation of National Food Security Act, with Odisha, UP and Andhra Pradesh topping the General Category states/UTs. Among the Special Category states/UTs, Tripura stood first, followed by Himachal Pradesh and Sikkim. They were judged on three points- coverage, targeting and provisions of the Act; delivery platform; and nutrition initiatives.

185.title: I never backed any film or mentioned smoking: Mahua on remarks over Goddess Kali
185.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra clarified her remark about Goddess Kali, wherein she said, "To me, Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting Goddess." "I never backed any...film...or poster or mentioned...smoking. Suggest you visit...Maa Kali in Tarapith to see what food & drink is offered as bhog," she tweeted. This comes amid controversy over poster of 'Kaali', which shows the Goddess smoking.

186.title: Vaani is so focused, I'd try to distract her on 'Shamshera' set: Ranbir
186.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor called his 'Shamshera' co-star Vaani Kapoor a very fine actor, adding that she is so focused that she is always wearing headphones on set and trying to be in character. "Many times I've tried to distract her and just have [a] stupid conversation," the actor added. He further said that the two have really befriended each other.

187.title: Man who intruded into CM Mamata's house carried iron rod: Police
187.article_body: The man who intruded into West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's residence had carried an iron rod with him, the police said on Tuesday. The rod was hidden under the man's shirt, but it fell on the ground during his escape attempt, an officer said. "We are questioning him to know the purpose of carrying it with him," the officer added.

188.title: Wanted to be contestant on 'Jhalak...' but was told I'm not famous: Maniesh
188.article_body: Host-actor Maniesh Paul has revealed that he had initially wanted to appear as a contestant on dance reality show 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa' but was told he doesn't have a famous enough face. Maniesh was later asked to host the show. "I signed [the contract]...I didn't even read it and that again became a turning point," he added.

189.title: US has so far witnessed 309 mass shootings in 2022: Report
189.article_body: US has so far witnessed 309 mass shootings and 15 mass killings in 2022, according to data by Gun Violence Archive (GVA). This comes as at least six people were shot dead and several others left injured during Independence Day Parade in Illinois. As per GVA data, 10,072 people have died due to firearms so far in US this year.

190.title: Katariya's 45th-min goal helps India hold China to a 1-1 draw in women's hockey WC 2022
190.article_body: India held China to a 1-1 draw on Tuesday to register their second straight draw in the women's hockey World Cup 2022. Jiali Zheng opened the scoring for China in the 26th minute with a field goal, before India's Vandana Katariya equalised in the 45th minute with a penalty corner. India are currently second on the Pool B points table.

191.title: Someone once told me that I'm too pretty for a role: Prachi Desai
191.article_body: Actress Prachi Desai said someone told her that she's "too pretty" for certain kind of roles. She added, "I said 'thank you' to the director for at least telling me that. I am just happy here that they are not doubting my skill, they don't think I lack anything there." "I...don't know what's the right reaction for that," she said.

192.title: Vijay Kumar Janjua appointed Chief Secretary of Punjab
192.article_body: The Punjab government has appointed Vijay Kumar Janjua as Chief Secretary to the Government of Punjab and in addition, Principal Secretary of the Department of Personnel and Vigilance. Earlier, the position was held by Anirudh Tewari. Tewari has now been posted as the Director General of Mahatma Gandhi State Institute of Public Administration.

193.title: Talks to convert Delhi into full UT, move will face resistance: Kejriwal
193.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday alleged that the Centre might dissolve the Delhi Assembly and convert the city into a full Union Territory, adding that the move will face stiff resistance from residents. "They (BJP) fear the AAP and that is why they do not want elections. Kejriwal will keep coming and going, Kejriwal is not important," he said.

194.title: Turkey should play by the rules: Greek Defence Minister
194.article_body: Greek Defence Minister Nikolaos Panagiotopoulos on Tuesday said that Greece "would like to be able to engage with Turkey but Turkey has to play by the rules". "Turkey should not be playing by its own rules, especially rules like the rule of military might and unilateral actions," he added. The two countries have differences over several issues.

195.title: Razorpay shared donor data with police without informing us: Alt News; Razorpay replies
195.article_body: Razorpay has responded after fact-checking website Alt News said that the payments gateway handed over its donor data to the police without informing them. Razorpay said that it received an official written notice from police authorities which it complied with, by sharing the data. "We tried reaching out to the company but did not receive any response," it further said.

196.title: 'Khuda...' makers apologise for hurting religious sentiments with song Haq Hussain
196.article_body: The makers of 'Khuda Haafiz: Chapter II – Agni Pariksha' have issued an apology for hurting religious sentiments of Shia Muslims with song 'Haq Hussain'. The makers have removed the zanjeer blades from the song and changed the lyrics to 'Junoon Hai'. They further clarified that no member of the Shia Muslim community has been presented in a bad light.

197.title: Cong has no right to demand HM's resignation over PSI scam: K'taka CM
197.article_body: Criticising Congress for demanding Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra's resignation over his alleged involvement in the Police Sub-Inspector recruitment scam, CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said the opposition party has no "moral right". It is only because of Jnanendra's honesty and efficiency that irregularities were exposed during the preliminary investigation, the CM added.

198.title: Action to be taken if posters of film 'Kaali' not removed: MP minister
198.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Tuesday said strict action will be taken if posters of the documentary 'Kaali', showing the goddess smoking a cigarette, are not removed. He said goddess Kaali's "insult" will not be tolerated. "We will also think about getting this film banned in Madhya Pradesh," he added.

199.title: Fan makes Dinesh Karthik's portrait with 600 Rubik's Cubes, video goes viral
199.article_body: A video of a fan making cricketer Dinesh Karthik's portrait with 600 Rubik's Cubes has gone viral on social media. Karthik also responded to the fan's video, writing, "Very nice work Prithvi...Highly impressive." Meanwhile, a Twitter user commented, "Unreal. Simply superb. Great form of Art. Keep it going." Karthik recently made his comeback to Team India.

200.title: India may not depend on imported urea after 2023–24: Mandaviya
200.article_body: Union Minister for Chemicals and Fertilisers Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said, "By 2025, through eight urea plants, India will produce 44 crore Nano Urea Bottles per annum which will be equivalent to 200 LMT...conventional urea." With this, import of urea may not be required in India after 2023-24 and the government will save ₹40,000 crore approximately per annum, he added.

201.title: Emirates plane flies for 14 hours from Dubai to Australia with large hole on its side
201.article_body: An Emirates flight from Dubai to Brisbane flew for around 14 hours with a large hole on its side. The airline said it was created when one of the tyres burst shortly after take-off. "At no point did it have...impact on...fuselage, frame or structure of...aircraft," Emirates stated. No passengers were injured and the flight was able to complete its journey.

202.title: My middle-class roots keep me grounded: Kartik on 'Bhool...' success
202.article_body: Speaking about being level-headed amid success, actor Kartik Aaryan said that his middle-class roots keep him grounded. The actor added he will always be "this guy from Gwalior" who had dreams and ambitions to chase. Kartik further said even if things around him change, he will fundamentally not change at all. His 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has grossed ₹230 crore worldwide.

203.title: 16-yr-old Indian-origin boy stabbed to death in UK, 3 people charged
203.article_body: A man and two teenagers have been charged with the murder of a 16-year-old Indian-origin boy who was allegedly stabbed to death in UK's Wolverhampton on June 29. The victim, identified as Ronan Kanda, died at the scene after being stabbed twice, post-mortem report revealed. "Detectives are keen to hear from anyone...who may have captured dashcam footage of...attack," police said.

204.title: 34-year-old mother-of-two Maria reaches first Grand Slam semis at Wimbledon
204.article_body: World number 103 Tatjana Maria came from 2-4 down in the final set to beat fellow German Jule Niemeier 4-6, 6-2, 7-5 to reach her maiden Grand Slam semi-final at Wimbledon on Tuesday. The 34-year-old mother of two won the quarter-final match in two hours 18 minutes. "I've goosebumps everywhere. It was such a tough match against Jule," said Maria.

205.title: It was my proposal to make Eknath Shinde Maha CM: Devendra Fadnavis
205.article_body: BJP leader and Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Tuesday said, "It was my proposal to make Eknath Shinde the CM..but senior party leaders insisted that government won't run if I stayed out of it, so I accepted the Deputy CM post on their command." He added that it is his responsibility to ensure that Shinde is a successful CM.

206.title: Israelis are lucky to have Yair Lapid as PM: French Prez Macron
206.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday said that the people of Israel are lucky to have Yair Lapid as the new Prime Minister. Macron made the comment ahead of a meeting with the Israeli leader in Paris. Notably, it is the first overseas trip by Lapid since he took over as the caretaker PM last week.

207.title: Balancing emotion, humour without crossing line difficult: 'JugJugg...' director
207.article_body: 'JugJugg Jeeyo' director Raj Mehta has said that trying to balance emotion and humour is creatively very difficult, adding they had to make sure the line is not crossed. "It's gratifying to see the reaction [to the film]," he said. Raj added that it's a family film and they had enough sensibility to understand the difference between right and wrong.

208.title: Experts to visit K'taka districts to look into back-to-back tremors
208.article_body: A team of experts from Hyderabad-based CSIR-National Geophysical Research Institute will soon visit Kodagu and Dakshina Kannada districts in Karnataka to look into back-to-back earthquakes in the two districts. "The district administrations in the two districts have already instructed officials to continuously monitor the situation," Karnataka Revenue Minister R Ashoka said.

209.title: IAS officer arrested for sexually harassing IIT student after a party in Jharkhand
209.article_body: Sub-Divisional Officer of Khunti Sayyed Riyaj Ahemed was arrested on Monday for allegedly sexually harassing an IIT student in Jharkhand, police said. The 2019-batch IAS officer allegedly harassed the girl after attending dinner party hosted at the Deputy Development Commissioner's residence. Prima facie, the allegation was found to be true after Ahemed and guests were questioned, police said.

210.title: Karan Johar donates ₹11 lakh for Assam flood relief, CM thanks him
210.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar donated ₹11 lakh for flood relief to the Assam Chief Minister's Relief Fund on Tuesday. Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma shared the news on Twitter, writing, "Grateful to...Karan Johar and Dharma Productions for contributing ₹11 lakh to CM Relief Fund." Biswa also thanked filmmaker Rohit Shetty for his initiative of getting the film industry together for Assam.

211.title: Don't know what went wrong: Dhaakad producer on film's failure at box office
211.article_body: Speaking about the failure of film Dhaakad, producer Deepak Mukut said, "I don't know what went wrong but I would like to believe that it's people's choice, what they accept and what they not and what they want to watch as well." "But according to us, we feel proud to have made a good, female-led spy action thriller," he added.

212.title: Ex-H'yana CM Chautala moves HC challenging sentencing by trial court
212.article_body: Ex-Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala has moved to the Delhi High Court, challenging a trial court's order which sentenced him to four years imprisonment in a disproportionate assets case. Chautala's Advocate Harsh Sharma has confirmed the move. The trial court had also imposed a ₹50 lakh fine on Chautala and ordered the confiscation of his four properties in the order.

213.title: Pics show waterlogging in Mumbai after heavy rain
213.article_body: Heavy rainfall in Mumbai and its suburbs on Monday night and Tuesday morning left several parts of the city waterlogged, leading to disruption of traffic movement. Officials said local train services were affected mainly on Central Railway's main and harbour corridors due to waterlogging on tracks. The IMD has issued an orange alert in the city till July 8.

214.title: Could have become CM had I requested: Maharashtra Deputy CM Fadnavis
214.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Tuesday said he could have become the Chief Minister of the state had he requested. "We made Shiv Sena (leader) CM for ideology," he said. Fadnavis added, "It was my proposal to make Eknath Shinde CM, but senior party leaders said the government won't run if I stayed out."

215.title: Uddhav Thackeray, Sanjay Raut not accepting reality: Kirit Somaiya
215.article_body: As Shiv Sena's Uddhav Thackeray and Sanjay Raut continued to criticise the newly-elected Eknath Shinde-led government, BJP leader Kirit Somaiya condemned them, saying they are not accepting the reality. "Thackeray needs to introspect now. Raut is accusing BJP of betraying them, rather he betrayed us by taking votes in the name of PM Modi in the 2019 elections," Somaiya said.

216.title: Keanu Reeves answers fan's 'rapid fire' questions at US airport
216.article_body: Actor Keanu Reeves, who recently travelled from London to New York, replied to the "rapid-fire" questions of a fan after landing in US. Television producer Andrew Kimmel shared the encounter on Twitter which is going viral. The fan asked Keanu for an autograph and asked questions like where he is staying and what he will do which Keanu "happily" answered.

217.title: Confident that Murmu will comfortably win Prez elections: Bihar CM
217.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Tuesday said he is confident that NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu will comfortably win the election. "It's a matter of happiness that a tribal woman is running for the highest constitutional position of the country," Nitish Kumar said. Droupadi Murmu, who visited Patna, met NDA leaders and sought their support for the upcoming Presidential elections.

218.title: HC judge threatened for exposing BJP's corrupt govt in K'taka: Rahul
218.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised the BJP government for threatening an HC judge with transfer for exposing the party's corrupt government in Karnataka. "Institution after institution is being bulldozed by the BJP. Each of us must stand with those fearlessly doing their duty," Gandhi said, using the hashtag #DaroMat.

219.title: Regularisation of pourakarmikas' services has begun: K'taka CM
219.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday announced that regularisation of pourakarmikas' services has begun in the state. The pourakarmikas, who were protesting since July 1 demanding regularisation of their services, called off their protest and welcomed the government's decision. "Realising their plight, I had announced ₹2000 monthly hardship allowance for them in the budget," Bommai said.

220.title: Will present debt restructuring programme to IMF by Aug: Sri Lanka PM
220.article_body: Amid ongoing economic crisis, Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe told the parliament on Tuesday that the country will present a debt restructuring programme to the International Monetary Fund (IMF) by August to seek a bailout package. He added that negotiating with IMF is more challenging than earlier due to the nation's bankruptcy. Sri Lanka's total foreign debt is $51 billion.

221.title: I cried when Alia Bhatt told me she was having a baby: Karan Johar
221.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar revealed that he cried when actress Alia Bhatt told him that she was having a baby. "My first emotion was that tears just came out and she came and gave me a hug," he added. Karan further said it's like his baby is having a baby and he can't wait to hold her child in his arms.

222.title: Bombay HC refuses to grant relief to woman alleging forced marriage
222.article_body: The Bombay HC has refused to annul the marriage of a 33-year-old woman, who claimed that she was forced to marry the man and was tortured by him since she was 14 years old. A division bench of Justices KR Shriram and PK Chavan said that the evidence provided by the woman was "improbable, unbelievable and unacceptable".

223.title: Zimbabwe to introduce gold coins amid high inflation rate
223.article_body: The Reserve Bank of Zimbabwe said it will introduce gold coins as a store of value to control the inflation rate that has considerably weakened the local currency. The Governor of the bank said that the gold coins will be called 'Mosi-oa-tunya'. The term, inspired by Victoria falls, means the smoke that thunders.

224.title: HDFC-HDFC Bank merger gets 'no objection' letter from RBI
224.article_body: HDFC Bank on Monday said it has received the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) approval for its potential merger with its parent company HDFC. "The RBI has accorded its 'no objection' for the scheme...subject to certain conditions," it stated. The merger, which received approval from BSE and NSE last week, remains subject to approvals from the CCI and the NCLT.

225.title: Tiger Shroff's mother shares pics showing his grandfather who fought in WWII at 18
225.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff's mother, Ayesha Shroff, on Tuesday shared pictures of her father who fought in World War II. "Tiger's grandfather training to fly Tiger Moths. I guess he was around 18 or 19...when he fought in World War II," she wrote. "Decorated for his bravery by his India. I'm proud to be his daughter. Jai Hind," Ayesha added.

226.title: Was on verge of alcoholism when 'Dil Pe Mat Le Yaar!!' didn't work: Hansal
226.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta has revealed that he was on the verge of becoming "a certified alcoholic" when his 2000 film 'Dil Pe Mat Le Yaar!!' didn't work. "There was political backlash...I got depressed for 6-7 months...Luckily something snapped," he added. Hansal said he picked up the pieces and made 2002 film 'Chhal' and has never given up at the start.

227.title: We fell short with the bat on Day 4: Bumrah on India's loss at Edgbaston
227.article_body: After India lost the rescheduled fifth Test against England by seven wickets at Edgbaston, India stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah said his side fell short with the bat on Day 4. "And that is where we let the opposition in to let the match slip away from us," he added. India were bowled out for 245 in their second innings.

228.title: Indian tech startups can reach $200 bn revenue in 5 yrs: Chiratae Chairman
228.article_body: Indian technology startups have the potential to reach a revenue scale of $200 billion in the next five years, according to Chiratae Ventures Chairman Sudhir Sethi. In same time frame, at least 25 new-age technology companies will have a revenue of at least $1 billion each, he said. He added that venture equity capital is expected to grow about 10%.

229.title: India slip below Pakistan in World Test Championship standings after points penalty
229.article_body: India have slipped below Pakistan in the World Test Championship (WTC) standings after being penalised for slow over-rate against England in Edgbaston Test. After being docked two points, India are now fourth on WTC points table with 52.08% of points won, while Pakistan are third with 52.38% of points won. India have also been fined 40% of their match fee.

230.title: 8-member SIT to probe security breach at Bengal CM's home in Kolkata
230.article_body: Kolkata Police has constituted an eight-member Special Investigation Team to probe the security breach at West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's residence. A man was arrested for allegedly sneaking into the CM's residence in Kalighat on July 3. The man told the police that he did so thinking it was the Kolkata Police headquarters.

231.title: TMC condemns MP Mahua's 'Kaali is meat-eating, alcohol-accepting goddess for me' remark
231.article_body: Amid controversy over the poster of the documentary film 'Kaali', TMC MP Mahua Moitra on Tuesday said, "To me, Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess." TMC distanced itself from her remarks. "The comments made by [Moitra] and her views expressed on Goddess Kali have been made in her personal capacity...All India Trinamool Congress strongly condemns such comments," it tweeted.

232.title: We first thought 'Tu Cheez...' will look cheap: Shabbir Boxwala
232.article_body: Filmmaker Shabbir Boxwala said the team of 1994 film 'Mohra' thought that 'Tu Cheez Badi Hai Mast' will look cheap. He added lyricist Anand Bakshi said it's about alcohol and won't be degrading to the girl. Shabbir further said they had a tie-up with Bagpiper but they backed out, adding the Bagpiper person later called it his life's biggest mistake.

233.title: There was total belief while chasing down 378-run target at Edgbaston: Root
233.article_body: England batter Joe Root said there was absolute clarity and total belief while his side was chasing down the 378-run target in the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. "Absolutely didn't think of stepping away from the game," he added. Root, who was adjudged 'Player of the Series', scored 142* in the fourth innings. England beat India by seven wickets.

234.title: Ranveer to reprise Mukesh Khanna's role in 'Shaktimaan' remake: Reports
234.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh will reportedly enter into Mukesh Khanna's shoes and play the character of 'Shaktimaan' on the silver screen. According to reports, Mukesh Khanna's Bheeshm International had announced the remake of the classic superhero show 'Shaktimaan'. Reports added, Ranveer showed a keen interest in playing Shaktimaan and makers too feel he can bring a natural charisma to the character.

235.title: Bengal has turned into pile of explosives: LoP Suvendu writes to Amit Shah
235.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari, in a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah, on Tuesday said, "The state has turned into a...pile of explosives." Adhikari also demanded an investigation by the National Investigation Agency (NIA) over the "alarming situation in the state". Adhikari claimed a man died when the crude bomb he was making exploded.

236.title: Govt to earn ₹94,800 crore from windfall tax on domestic crude oil: Moody's
236.article_body: The government will generate close to $12 billion (₹94,800 crore) of additional revenue from windfall taxes on domestic crude oil production and fuel exports, as per an estimate by Moody's Investors Service. The tax increase will reduce profits of Reliance Industries and ONGC, it added. Last week, the government imposed a ₹23,230 per tonne charge on domestically produced crude oil.

237.title: Platforms have right to court, but must follow our laws: MoS IT amid Twitter lawsuit
237.article_body: Minister of State (MoS) for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said all foreign internet platforms have the right to court and judicial review in India. "But equally all...platforms operating here...have unambiguous obligation to comply with our laws," he tweeted. While Chandrasekhar didn't name any intermediary, the remarks come after reports of Twitter suing the government over content takedown orders.

238.title: US State Secy to meet Chinese Foreign Minister in Bali this week
238.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken will hold talks with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi in Bali this week, the State Department said. The talks will be held on the sidelines of G20 Foreign Ministers' meeting. Reportedly, the announcement comes as US President Joe Biden is considering scrapping tariffs on a range of Chinese goods to curb inflation in America.

239.title: Delhi records 32 cases of dengue in June, 143 so far this year
239.article_body: Delhi reported 32 cases of dengue in June, taking the tally of total dengue cases in the national capital to 143 so far this year, as per MCD data released on Monday. According to the data, no deaths have been reported due to the infection this year. In 2021, Delhi recorded 9,613 cases, the highest in last five years.

240.title: Delhi HC orders setting up of 42 commercial courts within 6 months
240.article_body: Delhi High Court on Tuesday ordered the setting up of 42 commercial courts in the next six months for the speedy redressal of cases. The court also directed the administration to file an affidavit disclosing availability of judicial officers who could man these commercial courts. The court granted the petitioner permission to re-approach if the order was not complied with.

241.title: Ms Marvel character is special, stands for representation: Director
241.article_body: 'Ms Marvel' director Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy has said that the character is special because it stands for representation. Ms Marvel, portrayed by Pakistani-Canadian actress Iman Vellani, is Marvel's first South-Asian superhero. Sharmeen further said, "As a Pakistani filmmaker, it is a dream to be able to bring the character to life...'Ms Marvel' has something for everyone."

242.title: S Arabia allows 1 mn hajj pilgrims in biggest turnout since pandemic
242.article_body: Saudi Arabia will welcome one million hajj pilgrims this year, including 8,50,000 persons from abroad, in the biggest turnout in two years since COVID-19 pandemic broke out. The vaccinated pilgrims, aged below 65 years, will attend the hajj under strict sanitary conditions with the Masjid al-Haram being disinfected 10 times a day. In 2019, about 2.5 million people performed hajj.

243.title: Nine killed as passenger bus falls 40 metres in Nepal
243.article_body: At least nine people were killed after a passenger bus lost control and plunged 40 metres in central Nepal's Bagmati province on Tuesday, officials said. The bus, which was en route to Kathmandu, was carrying 40 passengers at the time. The cause of the accident is being ascertained and injured persons have been sent to a local hospital, police said.

244.title: Varun Dhawan & Janhvi wrap Bawaal schedule in Amsterdam: Reports
244.article_body: Producer Sajid Nadiadwala and filmmaker Nitesh Tiwari announced their new project 'Bawaal', starring Varun Dhawan & Janhvi Kapoor, in March 2022. The film went on the floor recently and now, the two actors have wrapped the Amsterdam schedule. Janhvi took to Instagram to share a photo with Varun. The team will now head to Poland for the next stint.

245.title: Assam hit by 3.7 magnitude earthquake
245.article_body: Assam was hit by a 3.7 magnitude earthquake on Tuesday at 11:03am, the National Center for Seismology confirmed. According to the data provided by the government agency, the epicentre of the earthquake was located at a depth of 35 km. The agency has also recorded more than 20 earthquakes occurring off the coast of Andaman & Nicobar Islands since Sunday.

246.title: 20 students fall sick after eating meal at school in Telangana
246.article_body: Around 20 students of the Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya (KGBV) in Telangana's Adilabad allegedly fell sick after they consumed the food served under mid-day meal scheme on Monday. Parents claimed that after eating the food, students began to vomit and were taken to Bhainsa Area Hospital. "We've already voiced our complaints to higher officials," parents said.

247.title: Fuel, electricity should be brought under GST ambit: CII President
247.article_body: The Confederation of Indian Industry's (CII) President and Bajaj Finserv Chairman Sanjiv Bajaj on Tuesday told PTI that items like electricity and fuel should be brought under the GST ambit. "[It]  will further help simplify, cut costs...[and] make industry more competitive," he stated. He added that the number of tax slabs under the GST should be brought down to three.

248.title: He humiliated the Constitution: MoS MEA on Kerala Minister's remarks
248.article_body: Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan criticised Kerala Minister Saji Cheriyan over his comments regarding the Indian Constitution, calling it an anti-national statement. "Kerala Minister Saji Cheriyan humiliated the Indian constitution in his speech," Muraleedharan said. Cheriyan allegedly said that Indian Constitution is written in a manner that can be used to exploit people.

249.title: NATO countries sign off accession protocols for Sweden, Finland
249.article_body: The 30 member-countries of NATO have approved the accession protocols to include Sweden and Finland into its military grouping, in a move to further strategically isolate Russia. However, there remains uncertainty over Parliamentary approval from Turkey, which could still hinder the joining process. Turkey has demanded the Nordic nations to extradite "terrorists" linked to outlawed Kurdish groups.

250.title: Mumbai woman sends ₹7 lakh to wrong account, beneficiary says 'won lottery'
250.article_body: Cybercrime officials in Mumbai helped a woman get back ₹7 lakh, which she had mistakenly transferred to the wrong beneficiary bank account. A man, who received the money, initially claimed the amount was disbursed to him as part of a lottery win. "He failed to prove the claims. After much persuasion, he finally reversed the transaction," an official said.

251.title: Man kills 30-year-old wife over extramarital affair in Delhi; held
251.article_body: A man allegedly killed his 30-year-old wife over an extramarital affair in Delhi's Rohini, a police official said on Tuesday. Rohini DCP Pranav Tayal said they received the information about the murder on July 3, adding that after reaching the spot, they found the woman, wrapped in a bedsheet, lying on the floor. Meanwhile, police have arrested the accused husband.

252.title: 15 fishermen missing after boat sinks off eastern Indonesia
252.article_body: Search is underway for the 15 fishermen who went missing on Saturday after their boat sank in the Arafura Sea off the coast of eastern Indonesia, authorities said Tuesday. "Ten people have been rescued safely, but 15 others remain missing," a spokesman of the Indonesian rescue services stated. He added that a navy warship would join the search on Tuesday.

253.title: Video shows Tesla car on Autopilot trying to turn in front of an oncoming tram in US
253.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a Tesla car on Autopilot making an attempt to turn directly in front of an oncoming tram in US. In the video, the car moved to make the turn as soon as the traffic light turned green, without waiting for the tram to pass by. However, the driver immediately intervened, saying, "That's not okay."

254.title: 'Kaali' director booked in Delhi for poster of goddess smoking cigarette
254.article_body: Delhi Police has registered a case against Leena Manimekalai, the director of documentary 'Kaali', over a poster showing the goddess smoking cigarette. "Prima facie, the content appeared promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion and race," police said. It added the post was released on social media at a strategic time which is likely to entice religious sentiments.

255.title: Crypto lender Nexo offers to buy Vauld after it pauses operations
255.article_body: London-based crypto lender Nexo has signed an indicative term sheet with fellow lender Vauld that could potentially result in it acquiring the Singapore-based firm. Upon successful completion of the transaction, Nexo plans to acquire up to 100% stake in Vauld. This comes a day after Vauld suspended all operations on its platform citing "volatile market conditions" among other reasons.

256.title: 1,349 unlicensed weapons seized ahead of polls for urban bodies in MP
256.article_body: Authorities have seized 1,349 unlicensed weapons ahead of polls for urban local bodies in Madhya Pradesh, an official said. More than 2.58 lakh licensed arms holders deposited their weapons at their nearest police stations and preventive action had been taken against over 1.73 lakh persons, the official added. The polls will be held on July 6 and July 13.

257.title: Taliban govt to approach India regarding visas for Afghan students
257.article_body: The Taliban administration in Afghanistan has said that it will request India to issue visas to Afghan students enrolled in Indian educational institutes. The announcement was made by Taliban Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi after a meeting with Afghan students in Kabul on Monday, an official said. India recently reopened its embassy in Kabul but hasn't formally recognised Taliban government.

258.title: Hurt by turn of events, but will make Sena stronger: Uddhav
258.article_body: Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray has said that he was "hurt" to see some members ditching the party despite getting benefits and will visit Hingoli soon. Thackeray told Sena workers that it was painful to see MLAs and ministers, who won because of Sena workers and got everything (positions in the party) have left him.

259.title: Aurangzeb & Akbar responsible for inflation, unemployment: Owaisi
259.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday criticised the BJP government and said that Aurangzeb and Akbar are responsible for inflation, fuel price hike and unemployment and not PM Narendra Modi. "If children don't have jobs, then emperor Akbar is responsible," he said. "Had Taj Mahal not been built, petrol would have cost just ₹40 per litre," he added.

260.title: FIR against Ajmer Dargah cleric who offered to gift his house to whoever beheads Nupur
260.article_body: Rajasthan Police has filed an FIR against Ajmer Sharif Dargah cleric Salman Chishti after a video showed him offering to gift his house to anyone who beheads suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma for her remark on Prophet Muhammad. Dargah Station House Officer Dalveer Singh Faujdar said efforts are on to trace the 'khadim'. He said Salman has a criminal background.

261.title: Special win by England in 5th Test to level the series vs India: Tendulkar
261.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to congratulate England on their seven-wicket win in rescheduled fifth Test against India. "Special win by England to level...series. Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow have been in sublime form and made batting look very easy," he wrote. Root(142*) and Bairstow(114*) both hit centuries in fourth innings to help England draw the five-match series 2-2.

262.title: Indian Constitution written in a way that can exploit people: Kerala minister
262.article_body: Kerala minister Saji Cherian, while addressing a recent political programme, allegedly said, "The Constitution of the country has been written in such a manner that can be used to exploit the maximum number of people." Retired Kerala High Court judge BK Pasha has reportedly sought Cherian's resignation from CM Pinarayi Vijayan. CM Vijayan has asked Cherian to give an explanation.

263.title: Windshield cracks on Guj-Mumbai flight in 2nd SpiceJet incident today, plane lands safely
263.article_body: A SpiceJet aircraft, flying from Kandla in Gujarat to Mumbai in Maharashtra, suffered a crack on its outer windshield and made an emergency landing in Mumbai. This is the second incident in the day where a SpiceJet plane had to make an emergency landing. All passengers and crew members are safe, the airline said in a statement.

264.title: Ours is a govt where nobody will be insulted: Maharashtra CM Shinde
264.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said, "Ours is a government of common people. Ours is a government where nobody will be insulted." "Every community will be respected and taken forward...The state will be taken forward and the process of development will be taken forward," he added. Notably, Shinde-led state government won the floor test in Maharashtra Assembly on Monday.

265.title: Working with Kangana Ranaut in 'Simran' was a massive mistake: Hansal Mehta
265.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta talked about his experience of working with Kangana Ranaut in the film 'Simran' and admitted that working with her was a "massive mistake". Speaking to Mashable India, Hansal agreed that she is a good actress but also said they didn't gel with each other. He further said they had only shot what she wanted to shoot.

266.title: How does the WTC points table read after England's historic run chase against India?
266.article_body: After defeating India by recording their highest successful chase (378 runs) in Test cricket in the rescheduled fifth Test, England are seventh on the World Test Championship (WTC) points table with 33.33% of points won. Meanwhile, India are third with 53.47% of points won. The table is led by Australia, who have accumulated 77.78% of points won.

267.title: To me, Kaali is a meat-eating & alcohol-accepting goddess: Mahua
267.article_body: Amid controversy over the poster of the documentary 'Kaali' that shows the goddess smoking, TMC's Mahua Moitra on Tuesday said, "You have the freedom to imagine your goddess." "To me, Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess," she added. Moitra said there are some places where alcohol is offered to gods and in some other places it would be blasphemy.

268.title: CCTV footage of the moment Amravati chemist was murdered surfaces
268.article_body: A CCTV footage has surfaced weeks after the murder of Amravati chemist Umesh Kolhe, showing Kolhe surrounded by his killers before being attacked. Kolhe was stabbed to death by two men on a motorcycle on his way back from his medical shop. Kolhe was killed on June 21 after he shared a WhatsApp post supporting Nupur Sharma.

269.title: WhatsApp posts supporting Nupur forwarded on group by Amravati chemist surface
269.article_body: Some of the WhatsApp texts forwarded by Amravati chemist Umesh Kolhe, who was killed over WhatsApp forwards supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma, have been accessed by media. Kolhe reportedly forwarded messages supporting PM Narendra Modi and Nupur on a group called "Black Freedom". His post supporting Nupur was reportedly shared by his friend Yusuf Khan to other WhatsApp groups.

270.title: It was the biggest challenge for me to play Mithali: Taapsee
270.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu has said that playing former Indian women's cricket team captain Mithali Raj was the biggest challenge thrown at her in 'Shabaash Mithu'. "I'm anything but her in terms of demeanour. I took notice of her from her journey beyond cricket," she added. Taapsee further said that their ideologies are similar which helped them get along really well.

271.title: Rishi Kapoor was flamboyant & loud, Ranbir is complete opposite: Karan Malhotra
271.article_body: Director Karan Malhotra, who directed Ranbir Kapoor in 'Shamshera' and his late father, actor Rishi Kapoor in 'Agneepath', said that he has been fortunate to work with both of them. Elaborating on their differences, Karan said, "Chintu uncle was...very flamboyant, loud...and confrontational person." "Ranbir is the complete opposite...[He] is happy-go-lucky. He does his masti quietly," Karan added.

272.title: Absolutely listless: Sehwag on India's bowling in 4th innings of 5th Test
272.article_body: Virender Sehwag has said India's bowling in fourth innings of the rescheduled fifth Test in Edgbaston was "absolutely listless" following the visitors' seven-wicket loss. India managed to take three wickets in fourth innings. While Alex Lees was run out, Zak Crawley and Ollie Pope were dismissed by Jasprit Bumrah. "India have quite a few issues to address," Sehwag added.

273.title: India has signed MoUs to make UPI available in 3 countries: Vaishnaw
273.article_body: India has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Singapore, UAE and France to make Unified Payments System (UPI) available in these countries, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said. Addressing the inauguration of Digital India Week 2022, he added that India is currently in talks with 30 nations. Further, he stated that UPI has helped in avoiding the creation of monopolies.

274.title: Shiv Sena still hopeful of rebel MLAs' return to party: Sanjay Raut
274.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said that the party is "still hopeful" of the rebel MLAs' return to former CM Uddhav Thackeray's side. "They are our people, will come back. 'Subha ka bhoola agar shaam ko ghar aa jaye to usse bhoola nahi kehte'," he said. "Shiv Sena is Balasaheb Thackeray's. Cannot be anyone else's," he added.

275.title: Will work round the clock to make Maha number 1 state: Fadnavis
275.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis held a road-show in Nagpur on Tuesday. During the road-show he said, "We'll work round the clock to make Maharashtra the number one state in [India]." "We'll [Eknath Shinde-led state government] not only complete these 2.5 years in power, but will also form a government with a majority for the next five years," he added.

276.title: Cong workers put paper boats on Indore streets to protest against floods
276.article_body: Congress workers on Tuesday put paper boats on the waterlogged streets of Indore to protest against flooding concerns after heavy showers. A video of these party workers holding placards with scripted messages for Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan also surfaced online. Notably, urban local body polls will be held in Indore and Bhopal on July 6.

277.title: Nation wouldn't be in turmoil had PM, Shah appealed for peace: Baghel
277.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel criticised the Centre over Nupur Sharma's comments, asserting that turmoil across the country could be avoided if PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah appealed for peace. He also took a jibe at BJP-ruled states and said that there haven't been proceedings in a single state where BJP was in power.

278.title: President Kovind calls Assam CM, enquires about flood situation
278.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday called Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma and enquired about the prevailing flood situation in the state and the ongoing relief and rescue operations. "Extremely grateful for his concern. It'll boost our morale in overcoming this situation," Sarma tweeted. He said he was honoured to receive a call from the President.

279.title: Man critically injured after stray bull hits him in UP's Meerut
279.article_body: A man got critically injured after a bull hit him while he was going home in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. Reportedly, the bull's attack was so severe that the man's intestines came out. Notably, this is the second such incident in a week as an elderly man in Meerut was killed and a youth was injured by stray cattle last Tuesday.

280.title: AAP will move court to conduct MCD elections on time: Delhi CM
280.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday alleged that the Centre was using force and hooliganism and not allowing MCD elections in the city. "We will have to approach the court to get MCD elections conducted on time and we will do it," he said in the Delhi Assembly. Kejriwal added, "They don't want elections to be conducted."

281.title: PM Modi has captured sentiments, aspirations of India: Jaishankar
281.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday praised PM Narendra Modi and said that he has captured the sentiments and aspirations of the entire country. Speaking at an event on the book 'Modi@20: Dreams Meet Delivery', Jaishankar said that before 2014, the "Delhi media" gave the status of "national leader" to all its "friends and favourites".

282.title: 4 killed, 3 injured in a car-jeep collision in Rajasthan's Dausa
282.article_body: Police said that four people were killed and three others were injured in a head-on collision between a car and a jeep in Rajasthan's Dausa district on Tuesday. The car was on its way to Khatu Shyam Temple in Sikar district. The deceased, Sanu Soni, Akash Soni, Neeraj Soni and Karmendra Soni, were residents of Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur, police added.

283.title: Srinagar-Leh highway blocked after flash floods in J&K's Ganderbal
283.article_body: A cloudburst triggered by heavy rainfall caused flash floods, which blocked the Srinagar-Leh highway in Jammu and Kashmir's Ganderbal district on Tuesday. As per reports, several houses were inundated and sustained partial damages after flash floods in the Kangan town of the district. Work is reportedly underway to clear the blocked highway.

284.title: B'luru locals oppose Swiss Consulate-proposed project at Cubbon Park
284.article_body: Locals have opposed the proposal of introduction of 'Barn Parcours' at Cubbon Park by the Swiss Consulate in Bengaluru. Cubbon Park Walkers Association's President Umesh Kumar said the proposal would set a wrong precedent as every private company will think they can pass their projects. "The park has already shrunk...There're several parks...we don't see anything happening over there," he added.

285.title: Tunisia buys 8 military training aircraft from US
285.article_body: Tunisia on Monday announced that it has bought eight military training aircraft from the US. The delivery of the planes will be completed by 2026, with the first batch expected to be delivered in March 2023, Tunisia's Defence Ministry said. The bulk of the deal financing will be through the American grant and Tunisia will pay the rest, it added.

286.title: Special from England, chasing historic target with a cigar in the mouth: Michael Vaughan
286.article_body: Reacting to England recording their highest successful chase in Test cricket against India in the rescheduled fifth Test, Michael Vaughan tweeted, "This is special from England...chasing a historic target with a cigar in the mouth." Joe Root scored 142*(173) and Jonny Bairstow scored 114*(145) to help England chase down a 378-run target in 76.4 overs.

287.title: Suicide bomb attack on Pak military convoy injures 10 soldiers
287.article_body: A suicide bomb attack on a Pakistani military convoy in North Waziristan district on Monday injured at least 10 soldiers, according to a senior official. Of these, three security personnel suffered serious injuries and were taken to a military hospital, according to sources. Notably, no group has so far claimed responsibility for the attack.

288.title: Kartik Aaryan takes his team on 1-week vacation for 'Bhool...' success
288.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has taken his team on a one-week long vacation to Europe to celebrate the success of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. As per reports, the team includes his managers, stylists, spot boy and security personnel. The film is 2022's biggest Bollywood opener at the Indian box office and grossed over ₹230 crore at the global box office.

289.title: Chris Hemsworth's look from Mad Max prequel 'Furiosa' surfaces online
289.article_body: Pictures of Chris Hemsworth from the sets of 'Furiosa', George Miller's prequel to 'Mad Max: Fury Road', have surfaced online, revealing his look from the upcoming project. Reacting to the pictures, a user tweeted, "Chris Hemsworth makes any movie worth it," while another comment read, "He's miles away from MCU Thor world here." 'Furiosa' will release on May 24, 2024.

290.title: Another accused in Udaipur murder case sent to NIA custody till July 12
290.article_body: An NIA court in Jaipur on Tuesday sent another Udaipur murder accused, Mohammad Mohsin, to the agency's custody till July 12. He was reportedly arrested on Monday for his alleged involvement in the conspiracy to kill Kanhaiya Lal. Last week, the prime accused, Mohammad Riyaz and Gaus Mohammad, were sent to NIA custody till July 12.

291.title: 17-year-old boy cycles 2,713 km from Hyderabad to Leh in 26 days
291.article_body: A 17-year-old boy, Macharla Venkatesh, cycled from Hyderabad to Leh and covered a distance of 2,713 kilometres in 26 days. Venkatesh said that he travelled between 75 and 130 kilometres per day and mostly stayed near petrol pumps on his journey. He dedicated the journey to the memory of his best friend, who reportedly died in an accident last year.

292.title: Super fast speed for the entire family: Airtel Xstream Fiber
292.article_body: Airtel Xstream Fiber offers plans starting at ₹499 for every family member while catering to their different needs. Customers can enjoy up to 1 Gbps speed and connect multiple devices to the same Wi-Fi with Wi-Fi-only plans. They can also explore All-In-One Entertainment plans offering superfast Wi-Fi speed, 16+ OTT platforms, and 350+ TV channels.

293.title: Words aren't enough, take a bow: Hoggard on Root-Bairstow's 269*-run stand
293.article_body: Discussing the unbeaten partnership of 269 runs between England's Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow in the second innings of the fifth Test against India, ex-England pacer Matthew Hoggard tweeted, "That was amazing." "Words aren't enough, take a bow," added Hoggard. England recorded their most successful run chase in Test history after chasing down a 378-run target in the fifth Test.

294.title: 2 drunk men make hoax bomb call to railway police; arrested in Thane
294.article_body: Government Railway Police (GRP) arrested two men from Thane for allegedly making a hoax call about a bomb. The accused identified as Atul Prajapati and Pradeep Prajapati reportedly called GRP in an inebriated condition and said a bomb was planted inside Ambernath railway station on the intervening night of Sunday and Monday. Police, however, found nothing suspicious after search operation.

295.title: 7 held for cheating people in guise of black magic: Rachakonda Police
295.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police have arrested seven members of an interstate fake babas/sadhus gang. The accused persons cheated and threatened people in the guise of black magic and collected huge amounts from them through hawala, police informed on Tuesday. Meanwhile, cash worth over ₹8 lakh, Rudraksha Malas, a money counting machine and mobile phones have been recovered from their possession.

296.title: 2 killed, 1 missing after car falls into gorge in U'khand's Chamoli
296.article_body: Two people died while one went missing after their car fell into a 250-metre deep gorge near Badrinath in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district on Tuesday. The State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) launched rescue operations following the accident. While bodies of two deceased have been retrieved, a search is underway for another woman who was also in the car, an official said.

297.title: Suniel shares 1st look of his character from debut series 'Dharavi Bank'
297.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty took to Instagram to share the first look of his character from his debut web series 'Dharavi Bank'. "A new avatar, a new medium, a new journey...Presenting the first look of #Thalaiva, from #DharaviBank, my first step into the world of OTTs," he wrote. The web series will also feature Vivek Oberoi and Sonali Kulkarni.

298.title: Actor Amit Sadh gifts bike worth over ₹2 lakh to hairstylist: Report
298.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh has reportedly gifted a Jawa Perak worth over ₹2 lakh to his hairstylist. "Amit felt...his hairstylist...has been doing some great work with his hair and he wanted to reward him with something to show him his appreciation," a source was quoted as saying. Earlier this year, Amit bought a Ducati Hypermotard 950 RVE worth over ₹16 lakh.

299.title: I didn't choose cancer: Chhavi to a troll who blamed her for gaining sympathy
299.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal reacted to a troll, who blamed her for gaining sympathy. She shared the screenshot of a comment and criticised it for spreading negativity. The comment read, "Ohh ur here again to gain some sympathy and PR." She responded, "I didn't choose cancer, it chose me...You can't...imagine the courage it takes me to speak about it on...public forum."

300.title: Was practising vegetarianism, turned non-vegetarian during a shoot: Nithya
300.article_body: Actress Nithya Menen has said she was "practising vegetarianism for a while" before the shoot of her upcoming show 'Modern Love Hyderabad'. She added a chef was invited to cook Hyderabadi delicacies. "There was so much Hyderabadi food...At one point, I was like, just give me...chicken...I have to look authentic. So...I keep telling them, they turned me into...non-vegetarian," said Nithya.

301.title: I really liked it, I'm happy for dad: Shruti on Kamal Haasan's film Vikram
301.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan said that she's very happy about her father, Kamal Haasan's film Vikram's success. "I really liked it, and I am...happy for dad...It's amazing to just have films do so well, especially after the tough times that everyone has faced in the pandemic," she added. "I'm...so excited for everyone involved, it’s been such a resounding success," she said.

302.title: Russian astronauts celebrate capture of Ukraine's Luhansk in space
302.article_body: Russian astronauts aboard International Space Station on Monday celebrated Russia's capture of Ukraine's Luhansk. Astronauts Oleg Artemyev, Denis Matveev and Sergey Korsakov were seen posing with the flag of the self-proclaimed Luhansk People's Republic in a photo. Roscosmos, the Russian space agency, termed the capture a "liberation", stating that it should be celebrated "on Earth and in space".

303.title: 8th largest run-chase in Test history was a stroll in park: Bhogle on India's defeat
303.article_body: Reacting to India's seven-wicket defeat against England in the rescheduled fifth Test, commentator Harsha Bhogle said the bat didn't face any challenge from the ball for the last 200 runs. "The eighth-largest run-chase in [Test] history has been a stroll in the park," he tweeted. Earlier, the record for highest successful run chase against India in Tests was 339 runs.

304.title: Joe Root is the world's best Test batter currently: Virender Sehwag
304.article_body: Virender Sehwag has tweeted that he considers Joe Root as the best batter in Tests currently, following Root's fourth century of the five-match Test series against India. Root scored his fourth century on Day 5 of the rescheduled fifth Test against India. Root has now scored nine Test tons against India which is more than any other player.

305.title: This 7-wicket victory of England should hurt Team India: Irfan on 5th Test
305.article_body: Following India's seven-wicket loss against England in the rescheduled fifth Test in Edgbaston, Irfan Pathan tweeted, "This victory of team England should hurt Team India. That was too easy." Joe Root (142*) and Jonny Bairstow (114*) both scored centuries as England completed their highest-ever chase of 378 runs in Test history. The five-match series ended in a 2-2 draw.

306.title: Telecom industry warns against mobile tower installation scam
306.article_body: The DIPA (Digital Infrastructure Providers Association) and the COAI (Cellular Operators Association of India) have issued a warning against mobile tower installation scam. Fraudsters request for a "government tax" for leasing the premises under the pretence of installing a mobile tower, they said. The fraudsters sometimes also produce fake 'No Objection Certificate' from the IT Ministry.

307.title: Tesla cars now scan for potholes and adjust vehicle suspension
307.article_body: Tesla has confirmed in a new software update that its vehicles can now scan potholes and adjust the suspension to account for rough roads. The owners can activate the feature by selecting 'Comfort' under the Adaptive Suspension Damping setting. However, reportedly the feature is only going to be available in Tesla vehicles with adaptive suspension.

308.title: Fine on TCS in intellectual property case in US halved to $140 mn
308.article_body: The punitive damages levied on Tata Consultancy Services in an intellectual property lawsuit in the US have been halved to $140 million, it said Monday. As per the lawsuit filed by Epic Systems in 2014, TCS stole its trade secrets to develop its own product. TCS, found guilty in 2016, is expected to pay another $140 million in compensatory damages.

309.title: We appeal to citizens to recognise hollow nationalism of BJP: Pawan Khera
309.article_body: Congress' Pawan Khera said, "We appeal to the citizens to recognise hollow nationalism of BJP." Furthermore, Khera said, "BJP party had provided a ticket to Masood Azhar’s disciple Mohammad Farooq Khan from Srinagar’s ward number 33 in a regional election. Nupur Sharma is from your party…How many fringe elements have you been cradling to remain in mainstream?"

310.title: Centre playing with future of 6 lakh students of Delhi: Dy CM Sisodia
310.article_body: Deputy CM Manish Sisodia accused Centre of playing with the future of six lakh students in Delhi by repeatedly transferring senior officers. "Directors...secretaries of higher and technical education departments have been transferred within two-three months," he said. "No one has been appointed to the post of director of Higher Education for 22 days after transfer of previous director," he added.

311.title: U'khand people supported Uniform Civil Code by giving mandate to BJP: Dhami
311.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Tuesday said the people of the state showed support for Uniform Civil Code (UCC) by giving a mandate to the BJP government. "We've formed a committee that is seeking public opinion...consulting stakeholders and will form a draft. We have kept a six-month period for...procedure, once it concludes, we will implement UCC," Dhami added.

312.title: It was black day for country when Satyendar Jain was arrested: Kejriwal
312.article_body: People say Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain, who was arrested by ED in a money laundering case, is honest, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said on Tuesday. "I think it was a black day for the country when Satyendar Jain, who gave not only this country but entire world the concept of mohalla clinic, was picked up and arrested," Kejriwal added.

313.title: Siddaramaiah demands K'taka minister's resignation over PSI recruitment scam
313.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah on Tuesday demanded the resignation of state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra over the police sub-inspector (PSI) recruitment scam. "In...PSI recruitment scam, the officials shouldn't be blamed. Home Minister Araga Jnanendra is responsible for this scam as well as officials," Siddaramaiah said. Earlier, former ADGP Amrit Paul was arrested in connection with the case.

314.title: Trading platform MarketWolf raises $10 million in Series A round
314.article_body: MarketWolf, a trading platform, has raised $10 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Jungle Ventures and Dream Capital. Existing investors such as iSeed, 9Unicorns, Crescent and Riverwalk also participated in the round, the company said. Founded in 2017 by Vishesh Dhingra and Thomas Joseph, the Mumbai-based trading startup aims to help first-time investors.

315.title: Mohali smart school flooded after rainfall, all students shifted to hall
315.article_body: After rains lashed Punjab's Mohali, a 'smart' school in the district's Desumajra was flooded with rainwater. Reports said that after most parts of the school were flooded, the school authorities decided to shift all students into its main hall. "I had...contacted...Municipal Corporation for assistance...they took 24 hours to arrive," the school principal said.

316.title: NDRF team deployed in Kolhapur amid yellow alert due to heavy rain
316.article_body: A team of the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) has been deployed in Kolhapur after the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a yellow alert following heavy rains. The IMD has predicted intense rainfall in the western ghats on Tuesday and the next two days. Heavy rains have lashed the areas in western Maharashtra over the last 24 hours.

317.title: Priest tries to sexually assault 17-yr-old girl at her home in TN
317.article_body: A priest was arrested after he allegedly tried to sexually assault a 17-year-old girl, who lived in the neighbourhood, at her house after her grandmother went out for work in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore. The accused reportedly ran away after the girl, who lived with her grandmother and her sister, raised an alarm. The accused was booked under POCSO Act.

318.title: Couple found dead with their throats slit in UP's Kanpur
318.article_body: A couple was found dead with their throats slit at their residence in Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh. The bodies of the couple, identified as Munna Lal Uttam (62) and Raj Devi (55), were found in separate rooms, police said. It appears that the suspects were known to the deceased, police added. Notably, the couple lived with their son and daughter.

319.title: UP man called for counselling assaults policeman inside police station
319.article_body: A man, who was called for counselling by police in connection with a domestic violence case, allegedly attacked a policeman at a police station in Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri district. "His family has stated he is a patient of mental illness, we will take that into account if they produce supporting documents. Accused has been booked and detained," Mainpuri ASP said.

320.title: US F-35 fighters arrive in South Korea for joint drills
320.article_body: US Air Force F-35A stealth fighters arrived in South Korea on Tuesday for joint drills amid North Korea tensions. It is reportedly the first known deployment of the US stealth fighter jets to South Korea since December 2017. The deployment is aimed at demonstrating the South Korea-U.S. alliance's strong deterrence and combined defence posture, South Korea's Defence Ministry said.

321.title: NATO nations sign accession protocols for Sweden, Finland
321.article_body: The 30 NATO allies on Tuesday signed off on the accession protocols for Sweden and Finland, sending the membership bids of the two nations to the alliance capitals for legislative approvals. "This is truly a historic moment for Finland...Sweden and...NATO," the alliance's Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said. This comes days after Turkey lifted its veto on the Nordic countries' membership bids.

322.title: It was depressing to lie dumped in the backyard: IAS officer as he resigns from service
322.article_body: Daulat Desai, a 2008-batch IAS officer, has resigned from service and wrote on Facebook that it was "quite depressing to lie dumped in the backyard". "I've...voluntarily stepped out of the so-called steel frame, Indian Administrative Service, leaving behind all...Power, Security, Status and Prestige!" he wrote. "Now it's time to shed...'aura' of IAS and be a 'Common Man'," Desai added.

323.title: Sri Lanka planning to stop printing notes as inflation nears 60%
323.article_body: Sri Lanka, which is facing one of the worst economic crises in years, plans to stop printing local currency as inflation nears 60%, the highest in Asia. The nation had been printing currency in order to pay salaries. PM Ranil Wickremesinghe told parliament that talks for a bailout from the IMF are complicated as the nation is bankrupt.

324.title: Joe Root smashes his 28th Test hundred, 11th since 2021
324.article_body: England batter Joe Root smashed his 28th hundred in Test cricket in the rescheduled fifth Test against India. Notably, this is Root's 11th Test hundred in the last two years. Reacting to this, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan tweeted, "He's getting better and better...ridiculous thing to say about England's greatest." Ex-India player Irfan Pathan also tweeted, "Root's an absolute run machine."

325.title: Sania Mirza-Mate Pavic reach maiden mixed doubles semis at Wimbledon
325.article_body: India's Sania Mirza and her Croatian partner Mate Pavic reached their maiden mixed doubles semi-final at Wimbledon on Monday. The sixth seeds beat the fourth-seeded Canadian-Australian pair of Gabriela Dabrowski and John Peers 6-4, 3-6, 7-5 in the quarterfinal. The match lasted one hour 41 minutes. Notably, 35-year-old Sania is playing in her last Wimbledon.

326.title: Why is BJP silent over horrific attacks on Dalits-Adivasis?: Priyanka
326.article_body: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticised BJP-ruled states and claimed that atrocities on Dalits and tribals have gone up in these states. "Why has the BJP, which is using the names of Dalits-Adivasis for elections, kept silent about these horrific incidents of attacks on Dalits-Adivasis," she said, citing instances of them being attacked in Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh.

327.title: 4 arrested for kidnapping & assaulting man in Gurugram
327.article_body: Four people have been arrested for allegedly kidnapping and assaulting the caretaker of a warehouse over personal enmity in Gurugram last week, the police said on Monday. A person who is contracted with maintaining the security at the warehouse is the main accused. Two vehicles and a stick used in the crime have been recovered, according to officials.

328.title: Businessman arrested for ITC fraud of ₹35 crore in Mumbai
328.article_body: The Directorate General of Goods and Services Tax Intelligence department arrested a businessman of a Mumbai-based company for allegedly being involved in fraudulent availing of Input Tax Credit (ITC) of ₹35.11 crore. "Despite...24 months having lapsed since the initiation of the investigation, the businessman had not provided...evidence and records sought by the CGST office," an official said.

329.title: Man repeatedly rapes Delhi woman on pretext of marriage, arrested
329.article_body: A Gurugram man was arrested on Monday for allegedly raping a woman on the pretext of marrying her, police said. The woman, in her complaint, stated that the two met on a dating app and the accused raped her for several months. The accused tried raping her again on July 2, following which she approached the police.

330.title: Italy declares state of emergency in regions as longest river dries up
330.article_body: Italy on Monday declared a state of emergency in regions surrounding the river Po amid ongoing drought. The decree will allow authorities to take action, if they deem it necessary, such as imposing water rationing for houses and business establishments. Po, which is Italy's longest river, has significantly shrunk in size in the last two years due to scarce rainfall.

331.title: England record their highest successful chase in Test history vs India, series ends 2-2
331.article_body: England chased down a 378-run target against India in the rescheduled fifth Test to record their highest successful run chase in Test history. England's previous highest successful run chase in Test cricket had come against Australia in Ashes 2019, when they chased down a target of 359. With England's win at Edgbaston, the five-match series ended in a 2-2 draw.

332.title: ₹500 fine for not wearing mask in Chennai from tomorrow amid rise in COVID cases
332.article_body: Amid a rise in COVID-19 cases, the Greater Chennai Corporation has made the wearing of face masks mandatory and announced a fine of ₹500 for those found violating the rule from July 6 (Wednesday). It has asked business establishments to ensure staffers and customers wear masks and maintain social distancing. The city reported 1,066 COVID-19 cases on Monday.

333.title: Twitter sues Indian govt over content removal orders, alleges abuse of power: Report
333.article_body: Twitter has filed a lawsuit against the Indian government seeking to overturn some of its orders to take down content, Reuters reported. Twitter is attempting to get a judicial review on these orders and has alleged abuse of power by Indian officials, the report added. The government had warned Twitter of criminal proceedings if it didn't comply with the orders.

334.title: Vastu expert Chandrashekhar Guruji stabbed to death in K'taka hotel; act caught on CCTV
334.article_body: Saral Vastu fame Chandrashekhar Guruji was stabbed to death in broad daylight in hotel near Unkal Lake in Karnataka on Tuesday. The murder was caught on a CCTV camera installed in the lobby of the hotel and showed one of the two men touching his feet before stabbing him multiple times. The accused escaped from the spot.

335.title: Show wasn't good enough: Adele on backlash for postponing Las Vegas show
335.article_body: Singer-songwriter Adele has reacted to the backlash she faced over postponing the Las Vegas residency at Caesars Palace, saying that the show wasn't good enough. "You can't buy me...I'm not going to just do a show because I have to or because people will be let down or because we're going to lose loads of money," she added.

336.title: PMC disaster management cell warns about 39 flood-prone spots
336.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation's disaster management cell warned there are 39 flood-prone spots in the city. It said the spots will get flooded if 28,000 cusecs of water is released from Khadakwasla dam ahead of heavy rainfall likely in coming days. Encroachments, dumping of debris in river beds and nullahs have decreased the water flowing capacity of natural bodies, it added.

337.title: SC judges pronounced Nupur Sharma guilty without trial: Retired judges in open letter
337.article_body: An open letter signed by 15 retired judges, 77 retired bureaucrats and 25 retired armed forces officers against Supreme Court's observations on Nupur Sharma has been sent to CJI NV Ramana. "Forcing a petitioner by such damning observations, pronouncing her guilty without trial, and denial of access to justice...can never be a facet of a democratic society," the letter stated.

338.title: Meghalaya YouTuber educated by police on responsible news circulation
338.article_body: A YouTuber was summoned by Meghalaya Police on Tuesday for allegedly circulating "news-like" sensitive information without following proper procedure as per norms to function as a media outlet. He received education on how to share information of public interest responsibly. He was asked to abstain from using sensitive information to push his viewership without verification from authorities.

339.title: Woman falls off Ferris wheel in WB; suffers severe head injuries
339.article_body: A 26-year-old woman suffered severe head injuries after she reportedly fell off the Ferris wheel at Ramlila ground in West Bengal's Kolkata. The incident occurred on Sunday and the woman, who is said to be in a stable but serious condition, is currently being treated at a hospital. Three people, including the ride's operator, were arrested in the matter.

340.title: Company booked under Copyright Act for using Disney characters in birthday products
340.article_body: Maharashtra Police booked two persons and a company located in Thane district for allegedly violating the Copyright Act by using Disney characters in birthday materials without permission. The case was registered based on a complaint lodged by an official of Disney Enterprises. The police conducted raids at godowns of the accused and seized materials worth over ₹1.81 lakh.

341.title: Rupee hits fresh record low as it closes at 79.36 against US dollar
341.article_body: The Indian rupee declined by 41 paise to close at 79.36 on Tuesday, marking a fresh lifetime low for the currency. Earlier today, the rupee touched a record low of 79.15 amid concerns of a wider current account deficit. The concerns come after India's trade deficit widened to a record $25.63 billion in June from $9.61 billion a year ago.

342.title: Cab driver kills 33-yr-old techie in front of his family after fight over OTP in Chennai
342.article_body: A cab driver has been arrested for allegedly killing a 33-year-old techie in Chennai after an argument over the number of passengers and the sharing of the OTP, police said. The accused Ravi allegedly smashed his mobile phone on victim S Umendhar's head and beat him up in front of the latter's family. Umendhar was declared brought dead in hospital.

343.title: Society should be sensitive: HC on plea over different sexual orientation
343.article_body: A division bench of the Calcutta High Court, while hearing a habeas corpus case relating to a woman with different sexual orientation, observed, "Certain things might appear different...and if that difference is evident in any individual, the society should be sensitive." The woman claimed she was ridiculed by her neighbours and relatives over her inclination towards same-sex relationships.

344.title: B'luru 'no parking' sign says 'Don't think of parking here', pics go viral
344.article_body: Pictures of 'no parking' signs from Bengaluru have gone viral on social media. One of the parking signs said, "Don't even think of parking here", while the other one said, "No parking...not 5 minutes, not 30 seconds, not at all!". Sharing the pictures on Twitter, a user said, "Koramangala house owners got no chill for vehicle owners."

345.title: Video of shooting at US Independence Day parade surfaces
345.article_body: A video showing the shooting at an Independence Day parade in US on Monday has surfaced on social media. People can be seen running in all directions, seeking shelter. Six people were killed and more than 36 suffered injuries in the Highland Park shooting and the motive of the attacker is not known yet.

346.title: Varun said 'No hosting, you're the actor' while promoting 'JugJugg...': Maniesh
346.article_body: Host-actor Maniesh Paul has said that during the promotions of 'JugJugg Jeeyo', his co-star Varun Dhawan kept telling him, "No hosting, you are the actor."
