He added that something would happen to him on seeing the mic, but Varun held him and told him to relax and think like an actor. "That was very important," Maniesh said.

347.title: Samantha to make her B'wood debut opposite Ayushmann Khurrana: Report
347.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu will reportedly make her Bollywood debut opposite Ayushmann Khurrana in an upcoming untitled film, which will be a commercial entertainer. "[Samantha's]...been offered dozens of films...but only a few of them could titillate her even for consideration...The film is one of the most exciting scripts Samantha has come across," said a source as quoted by Peeping Moon.

348.title: Dil To Pagal Hai deserved it: Viju on not winning Best Music award for Gupt
348.article_body: Music composer Viju Shah has said he didn't feel bad about not winning a Filmfare award for the film 'Gupt: The Hidden Truth' in the Best Music category. "The film that won in the category, 'Dil To Pagal Hai', deserved it," he added. "I've never been fascinated by these things. I was nominated and that's fine," Viju further said.

349.title: Central Railway earns ₹1.27 cr from shoot of Kiran, Aamir's next film: Report
349.article_body: The Central Railway has earned ₹1.27 crore through shooting of Kiran Rao and Aamir Khan's next movie, reports said. "The film was extensively shot on railway premises...It took around 48-50 days for the unit to shoot whole film out of which they shot for 24 days on railway properties," Amit Kulkarni, who worked as line producer of the film, said.

350.title: Mandhana, Shafali gain in Women's ODI batters rankings after SL series win
350.article_body: India Women openers Smriti Mandhana and Shafali Verma have gained spots in the latest rankings for ODI batters. Mandhana jumped a spot to be ranked eighth while Shafali is now placed 36th. Mandhana and Shafali scored 94*(83) and 71*(71) respectively to help India win the second Sri Lanka ODI by 10 wickets. India Women lead 2-0 in three-match ODI series.

351.title: Vivian Richards honoured with Order of Caribbean Community award
351.article_body: Former West Indies skipper Sir Vivian Richards was honoured with the Order of the Caribbean Community (CARICOM) award at the 43rd Conference of Heads of Government in Suriname. "I want to congratulate Sir Viv on this tremendous honour...It is a most fitting honour for a true hero of our region," Cricket West Indies (CWI) President Ricky Skerritt said.

352.title: Told Federer he needs to come back so we can play at least 1 more time: Novak
352.article_body: Revealing what he told Roger Federer during a special ceremony marking the 100th anniversary of Wimbledon's Centre Court, Novak Djokovic said, "I told him...he needs to come back so we can play at least one more time." He added, "We've all seen how special it was when he entered Centre Court...he really is a legend in every aspect."

353.title: Single, low GST rate will ease burden on poor, middle-class: Rahul
353.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said a single, low GST rate will reduce compliance costs, prevent the government from "playing favourites" and ease the burden on poor and middle-class families. "GST on health insurance: 18%, GST on hospital room: 5%, GST on diamonds: 1.5%. ‘Gabbar Singh Tax’ is a painful reminder of who the PM cares for," Gandhi tweeted.

354.title: 1 arrested in Gr Noida for illegal occupation of custodian property
354.article_body: A 50-year-old man was arrested in Greater Noida on Monday for illegally occupying custodian property, also called enemy property, located in Jarcha village, police officials said. The accused had occupied the land allotted to a partition refugee using forged documents, officials added. The land is estimated to be worth crores of rupees, according to officials.

355.title: ECI issues notification for Vice-President poll, nomination process begins
355.article_body: The Election Commission of India (ECI) on Tuesday issued a notification for the election of the Vice-President, setting in motion the process of filing nomination papers by candidates. The last date for filing nominations is July 19. The term of incumbent M Venkaiah Naidu ends on August 10 and the next Vice President will take oath on August 11.

356.title: 3 killed, 1 injured in truck accident in Gujarat's Banaskantha
356.article_body: Three people died and one person was injured in a truck accident on a national highway in Gujarat's Banaskantha district on Tuesday. The deceased, all hailing from Rajasthan, were moving towards Ahmedabad when the driver lost control of the vehicle and hit another truck in front of it, an official said. About 20 livestock were also killed, the official added.

357.title: SP's Azam Khan, wife and son summoned by ED in money laundering case
357.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan, his wife and son for questioning in a money laundering case being investigated against him, officials said. All three have been summoned in connection with a case related to the construction of a university in Rampur. Notably, Khan's son Abdullah Azam Khan is an MLA from the Suar Assembly seat.

358.title: Ex-Mumbai Police chief appears before ED in NSE co-location case
358.article_body: Former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey appeared before the Enforcement Directorate in connection with the alleged National Stock Exchange (NSE) co-location scam. The IPS officer retired from service on June 30. The ED has already recorded former NSE managing director and chief executive officer Chitra Ramkrishna's statement in this connection.

359.title: MLAs should be allowed to speak in Khasi, Garo in Meghalaya Assembly: CM
359.article_body: Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma tweeted on Monday that the state Legislative Assembly's members should be allowed to speak and debate in Khasi and Garo languages in the House. He added that this is a step towards "promoting our languages". Sangma also had a discussion on the issue with the Speaker and Meghalaya Democratic Alliance leaders, an Assembly official told PTI.

360.title: Racket providing fake educational certificates busted in Rachakonda
360.article_body: A Special Operations Team along with Chaitanyapuri Police have busted a racket providing fake educational certificates, Rachakonda Police informed on its official Twitter handle on Tuesday. Further, police informed that four people have been arrested in connection with the matter.

361.title: IRCTC announces 11-day tour package to religious places from Oct 10
361.article_body: The Indian Railways has announced a new tour package, from 10-20 October, covering several religious places. The IRCTC Shirdi and Jyotirlinga tour, costing ₹18,450/person for standard and ₹29,620 for comfort category, will cover Dwarkadhish Mandir and Nageshwar Jyotirlinga in Dwarka, Mahakaleshwar and Omkareshwar Jyotirlinga in Ujjain and Somnath Jyotirlinga in Somnath.

362.title: Life expectancy in China improves to 77.93 years
362.article_body: The life expectancy of people in China improved to 77.93 years, with the main health indicators ranking among the top of middle and high-income nations, said the country's National Health Commission (NHC) on Tuesday. In 2019, the life expectancy in the country stood at 77.3 years, while it was just 35 years in 1949.

363.title: Stay away from politics: Pakistan Army chief to military officials
363.article_body: Pakistan Army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa has directed the country's commanders and other key officers, including from the Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI), to stay away from politics. This comes after several reports suggested that Pakistan military establishment was trying to "manipulate" the upcoming by-elections in Punjab to the disadvantage of the PTI party, led by ousted PM Imran Khan.

364.title: France brings back women terrorism suspects from Syria camps
364.article_body: France has repatriated 16 female terrorism suspects and 35 children from camps in northeast Syria, the country's anti-terrorism prosecutor said on Tuesday. The women, aged between 22 and 39, have been handed over to judicial authorities, while the children will undergo medical checkups, authorities said. Since 2016, France has reportedly repatriated more than 125 children.

365.title: IKEA to reopen for online fire sale in Russia before market exit
365.article_body: IKEA's Russian customers will be allowed to purchase goods in an online-only fire sale a final time before the company winds down its operations in Russia. "From July 5 for a few weeks you can buy IKEA goods only on ikea.ru. Goods will be on sale for as long as they are in stock," IKEA said.

366.title: Rupee hits all-time low of 79.15 against US dollar
366.article_body: The rupee touched a new record low of 79.15 against the US dollar during Tuesday's trade. Last week, it touched a record low of 79.12 and closed at 78.95 on Monday. A government official on Monday said that India is trying to "address volatility" in the Indian rupee, which has plunged 6% against the dollar this year.

367.title: Bumrah's appointment as captain is courageous move: Ian Chappell
367.article_body: Former Australia skipper Ian Chappell has said that it is a "courageous appointment" to make pacer Jasprit Bumrah, the stand-in captain for the Edgbaston Test. "Perhaps looking to emulate the success of captains Pat Cummins and Ben Stokes, India appointed Bumrah...[It] speaks volumes for Bumrah's on-field nous. Stokes' leadership battle with Bumrah will be a fascinating sidelight," Chappell said.

368.title: Raj isn't UP or Bihar, won’t be divided in name of Hindu-Muslim: State minister
368.article_body: Rajasthan Minister of State for Home, Rajendra Singh Yadav, said that Rajasthan is not UP or Bihar and it won’t be divided in the name of Hindu-Muslim or religion. He was reacting to a question, "Polarisation is rising in Rajasthan and it doesn’t help Congress. What is Congress doing to control it?" the Indian Express stated.

369.title: Ex-champion Halep beats Badosa to enter her 5th Wimbledon quarter-final
369.article_body: Former champion Simona Halep beat fourth-seeded Paula Badosa 6-1, 6-2 in the fourth round to enter her fifth Wimbledon quarter-final on Monday. "I'm really pleased with the way I played this tournament so far. Day by day, it's getting better," said Halep. The 16th seed will now face American Amanda Anisimova, who has reached her maiden quarter-final at the tournament.

370.title: First batch of Agniveers will have up to 20% women: Indian Navy
370.article_body: The Indian Navy officials have said that the first batch of Agniveers to be recruited under the Agnipath scheme will have up to 20% women, provided they meet the qualification terms. They will be sent to different branches of the country's maritime defence force, added the officials. They said that women will be allowed to work as sailors on warships.

371.title: 2 including 10-yr-old killed in lightning strike in Chhattisgarh
371.article_body: A man and his 10-year-old nephew died after being struck by lightning in Chhattisgarh's Korba district. The incident occurred on Monday when the deceased had gone fishing in a pond, an official said. As it started raining heavily, the two took shelter under a tree and were struck by lightning following which they died on the spot, he added.

372.title: 11 Bajrang Dal activist's murder accused booked for shooting reels in B'luru jail
372.article_body: An FIR has been registered against 11 persons, who were accused of murdering Shivamogga-based Bajrang Dal activist Harsha, for making video reels inside the high-security Parappana Agrahara Central Prison in Bengaluru. As per reports, the accused were also seen talking to their associates. The Karnataka government has ordered a probe in this connection.

373.title: Man fires at bouncer, accidentally shoots his friend outside Haryana club; video viral
373.article_body: A video showing a man open-firing at a club in Haryana's Panchkula and accidentally shooting his friend is being widely circulated on social media. He also injured a bouncer, police said. The accused has been identified as Mohit from Punjab's Ludhiana and had escaped from the spot with his injured friend.

374.title: Pune University starts admission for 2 certificate courses in music
374.article_body: The Centre for Performing Arts at the Savitribai Phule Pune University is offering two certificate courses in music and has started the admission process. The courses are being offered in collaboration with Maharashtra Cultural Centre. The first course is named Marathi Fine Music Course, while the other one is on music appreciation and there is no age limit for it.

375.title: AstraZeneca to buy biotech firm TeneoTwo for up to $1.27 bn
375.article_body: Drugmaker AstraZeneca has signed an agreement to acquire biotechnology firm TeneoTwo for up to $1.27 billion. AstraZeneca plans to acquire all outstanding equity of TeneoTwo for an upfront payment of $100 million, with additional milestone-related payments of up to $1.17 billion. The transaction may close in the third quarter of this year.

376.title: PM, Shah have assured full support for Maha development: CM Shinde
376.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah have assured full support for the growth and development of the state. "I am going to undertake a tour of the entire state and allot projects in every constituency. There will be a total transformation of the state," he said.

377.title: Sona Mohapatra tweets to Twitter CEO about alleged sexism at his alma mater IIT-B
377.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra on Tuesday tweeted to Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal while criticising his alma mater IIT Bombay for alleged sexism. While sharing a Facebook post from December 2016, she wrote, "[Your] alma mater has for decades, mostly never hosted women as headliners in their cultural festival. IIT-B alumni, even CEOs slammed me on Facebook for writing this letter."

378.title: Gay couple gets married in presence of family members in Kolkata, pics go viral
378.article_body: Abhishek Ray and Chaitanya Sharma, a gay couple, got married in a Hindu wedding ceremony in Kolkata on Sunday. The wedding was attended by close friends and family members. While Abhishek Ray is a fashion designer, Chaitanya Sharma works in digital marketing. "Ultimately, love conquers all, as it has no barriers, caste, creed, religion, and most importantly, gender," said Abhishek.

379.title: Video shows swimmers attacking shark with mop on Turkish beach
379.article_body: A video of a group of swimmers attacking a shark with a mop to chase it away in Turkey's Marmaris coast is going viral on social media. The video shows locals and tourists standing in water as the shark circles around them. After a few hits, the shark went in the other direction.

380.title: Which one: Babar Azam after reporter says 'You broke another Virat Kohli record'
380.article_body: A video of Babar Azam's response to a reporter on being asked about how he felt about breaking a record held by Virat Kohli went viral. The reporter said, "You broke another Kohli record," after which Babar interrupted him and asked, "Which one?" The reporter stated he was referring to Babar being number one T20I batter for the longest time.

381.title: 'Never-seen-before' crystals found in 21st century's biggest meteoroid to fall on Earth
381.article_body: Researchers have discovered "never-seen-before" carbon crystals in dust from a space rock that had exploded in Russia nearly a decade ago. The exploding space rock, known as a superbolide, fell on 15 February 2013, and is the biggest meteoroid to have exploded on Earth in the 21st century to date. Researchers published the study in EPJ Plus journal.

382.title: Employment hits 12-month-low in June as unemployment rate rises to 7.8%: CMIE
382.article_body: India's overall unemployment rate rose to 7.8% in the month of June, according to data from the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE). The fall in employment was led by unemployment in rural areas, which jumped from 6.62% in May to 8.03% in June. India saw its lowest employment in June in the last 12 months, the CMIE said.

383.title: Lucknow builder arrested over funding June 3 Kanpur violence
383.article_body: A builder from Lucknow, Haji Wasi, was arrested in connection with the violence that broke out in Kanpur on June 3, police said. Wasi is an accused who allegedly funded the violence and was on the run, police added. The violence had broken out amid protests against the alleged derogatory remarks about the Prophet by suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma.

384.title: Boulders fall from Thane hillock, house collapses in Palghar after heavy rains
384.article_body: Boulders fell from a hillock in Thane's Kalyan and a house collapsed in neighbouring Palghar following heavy rainfall in the two Maharashtra districts, officials said on Tuesday. No casualty has been reported in any of the incidents so far, they added. Waterlogging was reported in parts of the two districts and several people were shifted to safer places.

385.title: Euro slumps to 20-year-low against US dollar amid fear of recession
385.article_body: The euro slumped to a 20-year-low against the US dollar on Tuesday, after the latest surge in European gas prices added to a growing fear of recession in the region. The currency fell as much as 0.8% to its weakest level since December 2002. The euro has dropped more than 8% against the US dollar this year amid record inflation.

386.title: Religious sentiments shouldn't be hurt: Nusrat on 'Kaali' poster
386.article_body: Actress-MP Nusrat Jahan spoke about the poster of Leena Manimekalai's documentary 'Kaali', saying that religious sentiments should not be hurt. The poster shows a woman dressed as the goddess smoking a cigarette with a pride flag backdrop. "Let's not pull religion...and make it saleable...If you're coming up with something creative...take responsibility for your own actions as well," Nusrat said.

387.title: I enjoyed whatever roles I did, but I'm not an actor from foundation: Nikhil
387.article_body: DJ Nikhil Chinapa, who appeared in 'Shaitan' and 'Pyaar Kiya Nahin Jaata', said, "I thoroughly enjoyed whatever roles I did, but I'm not an actor from...foundation." He added he's "a lot more passionate about music than...acting". "If I wanted things to be different, I should've worked differently...If I wanted to act, I should've respected the craft of acting," said Nikhil.

388.title: Franchises are over: Chris Pratt hints at leaving Marvel Cinematic Universe
388.article_body: Actor Chris Pratt hinted at leaving the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) in an interview, saying that franchises are over. He portrayed Star-Lord in the 'Guardians of the Galaxy' films. "You want to be conscious and put a lot of effort into experiencing the moment...The emotion around the last ten years [is] sort of coming to an end," the actor said.

389.title: Will tell my daughter 'Do what you want, tumhara baap hai naa': Vidyut
389.article_body: Talking about the kind of father he would be, actor Vidyut Jammwal said, "I will tell [my daughter] 'Do whatever you want to do, tumhara baap hai na (your father is with you)'." Discussing restrictions imposed on daughters due to safety concerns, Vidyut stated, "[The] society...can bring a change...If it is one sister and two brothers, the brothers will...be good."

390.title: Rest & recover: Putin tells troops after Russia captures Luhansk region
390.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said the troops involved in the campaign to capture Ukraine's Luhansk region should "absolutely rest and recover their military preparedness". Putin called on forces on other fronts to pursue their aims according to "previously approved plans". Russia's capture of Luhansk is its last victory on our territory, Ukrainian Presidential Advisor Oleksiy Arestovych said.

391.title: We have chance to better our CWG record after Thomas Cup win: Gopichand
391.article_body: Indian badminton's chief national coach Pullela Gopichand has said that India's badminton contingent for this month's Commonwealth Games has a "chance" to improve its medal tally. "Last time [in 2018] we won two gold medals...But looking [at win] at the Thomas Cup, I'm sure we'll have a chance to better our records in the men's singles and doubles," he said.

392.title: Maharashtra cabinet expansion will be done soon: Dy CM Fadnavis
392.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, a day after the Eknath Shinde-led state government won the trust vote in the Assembly, said the state cabinet will be expanded soon. "Let us breathe properly. Devendra Fadnavis and I will sit and discuss cabinet portfolios and their allocation," said CM Shinde after winning the trust vote on Monday.

393.title: Single, low tax rate will reduce burden on poor people: Rahul
393.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised the government over GST rates and asserted that a low tax rate will help reduce the burden on the poor and the middle class. "GST on Health Insurance: 18%. GST on Hospital Room: 5%. GST on Diamonds: 1.5%. 'Gabbar Singh Tax' is a painful reminder of who the PM cares for," he said.

394.title: Nupur Sharma row a conspiracy by BJP to further its divisive policy: Mamata
394.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday alleged that the "Nupur Sharma controversy was a conspiracy by the BJP to further its divisive policy". "Why was she not arrested? Arrest her because you cannot play with fire," Mamata added. She said that the country's global image has been affected due to suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Mohammed.

395.title: Gurugram-based ENSUREDIT raises $4.2 mn in pre-Series A funding
395.article_body: Gurugram-based insurtech firm ﻿ENSUREDIT﻿ has raised $4.2 million in a pre-Series A funding round led by US-based Cover Genius. The funding also saw participation from investors such as 9Unicorns, NexStep Discovery, CP Ventures, Venture Catalysts and IPV. ENSUREDIT focuses on working closely with insurance distributors to enhance their sales force acquisition and productivity.

396.title: World's largest waterlily species discovered in Kew Gardens
396.article_body: Scientists have discovered the world's largest waterlily belonging to the genus Victoria at Kew Gardens. Named V boliviana, in honour of Bolivian partners in the research, leaves of the newly discovered waterlily species grow up to three metres. It has flowers which turn from white to pink and bear spiny petioles. It's one of the world's botanical wonders, scientists said.

397.title: 2 families stake claim on man's dead body in UP, DNA profiling process begins
397.article_body: The dead body of a man who was allegedly run over by a train in Uttar Pradesh was exhumed and the DNA profiling procedure was started after two families staked claim on the body. "Samples are being sent to the forensic laboratory. The next course of action will be decided on basis of the laboratory report," Sirathu Sub-Divisional Magistrate said.

398.title: 16-ft long wall collapses in Thane amid rains, 17 families relocated
398.article_body: Amid heavy rains in Thane, a 16-feet long security wall collapsed at a chawl in the Mumbra area on Monday, making 17 families temporarily relocate from their houses. The affected persons were shifted to rescue shelter set up at a Thane Municipal Corporation school. India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert for Mumbai for the next five days.

399.title: Himachal records highest fatalities in road mishaps among 3 hill states
399.article_body: Himachal Pradesh has recorded the highest road fatalities among three northern hill states, including Jammu and Kashmir and Uttarakhand, official data reportedly said. Data said that Himachal records an average of three deaths per day and around 3,000 people lose their lives in road mishaps in Himachal Pradesh annually.

400.title: Life is definitely easier in the commentary box: Ravi Shastri
400.article_body: Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri, who's currently commentating in the ongoing rescheduled fifth Test between India and England, has said life is "definitely easier in the commentary box". Shastri, however, also added, "To be honest, I have been richer by the experience (India coaching stint). The seven-year stint has been a huge experience for me."

401.title: Nearly 1,000 unknown microbes found trapped in Tibetan glaciers
401.article_body: Scientists have discovered nearly 1,000 new species of microbes in the frozen Tibetan Plateau. Almost 98% of these 968 bacteria species are yet unknown to science, some being over 15,000 years old. The study stated that when the glaciers melt, these microorganisms, possibly carrying novel virulence factors, could lead to local epidemics or pandemics in India and China.

402.title: Landslide in Mumbai's Ghatkopar area due to heavy rain, house damaged
402.article_body: A landslide incident was reported on Tuesday morning in Mumbai's Ghatkopar area in which a house was badly damaged amidst incessant rainfall in the city. However, no casualties have been reported in the incident so far. In the last 12 hours, Mumbai has recorded 95.81 mm of rain due to which areas are waterlogged and traffic movement has been affected.
